messages:
[{'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:04:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

I don't quite understand the intention of the changes here: are you addressing a functional issue, or a doc problem?"}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

That's my first commit, so I don't need review until I'am ok with the Gerrit workflow. As soon as all is ok, I will ask for a review ! :o)"}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

Still in progress.'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Ready For Review

Seems to be OK.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:46:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The way I see this is that statistics don't really exist as a first-class resource per se, more just as another view over the samples (with aggregation applied).

This view is computed dynamically on demand, when statistics for a particular duration & period are requested.

So in that sense it's entirely natural that the query constraints always apply to the underlying samples (as these are always the building blocks for the calculated aggregates).

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-18 10:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

"statistics don't really exist"
I totally agree, but what seems obvious because you know well Ceilometer and the way to deal with meters is not so obvious at first sight for users: I saw some of them trying to query on something else than sample's fields and asking why it doesn't work.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-18 10:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Eoghan, thing is Frederic, and probably others, got confused on /statistics as they though they could query it to retrieve statistics on things matching some statistics. Which is not true, so I see no harm precising it. :)'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-18 10:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Approved

Fair enough so.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 10:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Starting gate jobs.

doc: /statistics fields are not queryable (you cannot filter on them)

Add precision on the way of filtering queries and corrected some typos.

commit_message:
Register agent schedulers options in one place

Currently agent schedulers options are defined in neutron.scheduler and
every plugin that supports scheduling should register them individually.
It is reasonable to define and register options in one place - agentschedulers_db.

Fixes NeutronManagerTestCase when running separately by importing missing config option

Fixes bug 1198904

Change-Id: Ia9c1ad3fb4b71796401ef5507f741f3cc024a4da

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-10 16:27:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am not super=happy about surfacing driver-specific information up to tenant.

Being technology-agnostic is one of Neutron API tenets; it seems that this attribute might contain anything, including messages generated directly from teh driver (for instance a F5 or NetScaler error message), and thefore violates this tenet.

I understand this attribute gives more information to a tenant regarding the status of a resource; if the reason for the error is a problem in the underlying backend, what would be the benefit for the user?

If there is a strong argument for having this attribute I would like to insist on explicitly pushing a policy to restricting it by default to admins only."}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-12 07:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Yeah, I am totally agree with technology-agnostic tenet. My understanding of this is that drivers and plugins may update status_description field with some general messages rather than driver specific info which is non-informative for users. So I'm thinking of something like "HTTP cookie session persistence type is not supported by the choosen provider" - this in my opinion will be quite useful for the user.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-12 11:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

For these cases, would it be possible to fail the API request rather than delaying the failure to the driver?

I am removing the -1 at the moment, but we need to look closely at how this status field is then used by the lbaas implementation.

One way of doing it right would be not having it at all on the rpc interface with the agent, so that only the plugin can set it.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-12 12:43:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Well, the plugin may not know about driver capabilities and can't fail such requests itself, so only driver may explain what happened.

Another problem with restricting drivers on setting status description field is that currently plugin instance is passed to drivers (plugin drivers) on initialization so a driver may call any method of the plugin (including db methods). Right now rpc interface exists only between plugin driver and namespace agent for reference implementation - this interface doesn't include the ability of setting status description field."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-15 03:31:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I'm concern that status_description is not properly synchronized with the status field."}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-15 07:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-18 03:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-18 08:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 08:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

Fix duplicate config options

Removed them since they are registered in cinder.api.common

commit_message:
Put pre-created resources in state INIT COMPLETE.

Defines an INIT action, and make the resourse state
INIT COMPLETE before they are first created.

Calls to list resources will now include resource that have
not been created yet. This change allows resource topologies
to be displayed throughout the creation of the stack.

Implements blueprint build-heat-graph

Change-Id: I1d98ac21d44ff05183db38d49cbb3599e2812511

commit_message:
Tidy up authorization for quota_sets API v3

* Use policy instead of authorize_project_context
* Tide up

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 10:08:32.000000000', 'message': 'port-update fails when using SELECT FOR UPDATE lock

In Postgresql, it will throw the bellow exception when
using SELECT FOR UPDATE lock combined with outer join.
"SELECT FOR UPDATE/SHARE cannot be applied to the
 nullable side of an outer join"

The reason can refer http://www.postgresql.org/ \
message-id/21634.1160151923@sss.pgh.pa.us

for this issue, I don't think outer join is necessary，
so I change it to use inner join.

Fixes bug #1191653

Change-Id: Ifc9ecad91324ce28399431ea77fe0865b6d8e523
'}]
commit_message:
port-update fails when using SELECT FOR UPDATE lock

In Postgresql, it will throw the bellow exception when
using SELECT FOR UPDATE lock combined with outer join.
"SELECT FOR UPDATE/SHARE cannot be applied to the
 nullable side of an outer join"

The reason can refer http://www.postgresql.org/ \
message-id/21634.1160151923@sss.pgh.pa.us

for this issue, I don't think outer join is necessary，
so I change it to use inner join.

Fixes bug #1191653

Change-Id: Ifc9ecad91324ce28399431ea77fe0865b6d8e523

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

I just would like to avoid sources of confusion at any point in time in the openstack network source code base.

A situation where an option is defined twice in two different section is clearly a source of confusion (in theory one could put sql_connection in DEFAULT, quantum will not complain, but just ignore the configuration variable).

I don't want to look like an old grumpy man (I am just one of the two - you pick one!). In my opinion, solving the db pooling issues wiring openstack network into oslo.db has an higher priority and an actual advantage, so I would see that first.

Anyway since there's nothing fundamentally wrong with this patch I'm removing this -1 so other people can approve if they wish so."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The changes to the model base class, are fine, since we're preserving __iter__ and next which behave differently from the oslo model base class.

However, I would suggest to wait for merging this batch of code from oslo as we should leverage it for all the base db work. For instance, we should use it to do database connection and session retrieval too.

We were considering this before closing Grizzly-RC1, but at that stage it was too late in the release cycle.

Plugging oslo.db only for a 'better inheritance' of model base is per se a minor improvement. We are aware of problems in using db connection pooling with Quantum's current code, and so we should probably try to address that problem at the same time.

Also, this patch re-adds the sql options. No exception is thrown because instead of being registered in the [DATABASE] section they're registered in the [DEFAULT] section.

Summarizing, I am happy with this change, but I would like to see a cleaner transition to oslo.db"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

In the save method there is an issue - this uses the common session implementation. I do not think that this is good.
I would prefer that you wait till the DB support is used by common (I am currently implementing this - if you would like to wait a day or a few hours).
One of the issues that we have is [DATABASE] vs [DEFAULT] regarding the variables. I would prefer to leave it as DATABASE - this will require a change in the OSLO code - I think that we should try and look how that can be addressed - one thing that we do not want is the support to break when a version is upgraded."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
I have started - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27265/.
Some of the tests fail and they are under investigation.
It would be nice if we could get OSLO to have [DATABASE] as the section instead of [DEFAULT].
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Should we not wait for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27265/.
This is currently pending https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27345/ which will hopefully will be addressed once your patch for the section names is through https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27887/
Thanks for addressing the last issue
Phew! That was a lot...'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
I think that you should rebase this on:- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27265/
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Salvatore,

I totally agree with you and having oslo's session module getting to work with Quantum is on my todo list.

However, to do that at some point the ModelBase has to merge and I think it should be done in a separate patch with the session integration.

Since this patch only imports the model module and Quantum doesn't directly save() on models (based on grep), I believe it is safe to merge this patch.

Integrating the session is something I'm working on right now.
If you want to see Quantum using oslo session, this patch can wait till I finish and the patches can be merged subsequently.

Let me know if anything else needs to be done besides the config group adjustment."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

gary, Nova is already using oslo.db so I think there would be strong resistance against changing oslo code. I'll look at your patch and also try find the problem."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Salvatore,
I pick grumpy old man. JK :)

Gary,
Nice to know your on it. I'll wait till you finish and then rebase."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Apply Oslo ModelBase to NeutronBase

Oslo.db has ModelBase which implements most of NeutronBase's code.
Therefore NeutronBase should inherit from ModelBase to keep things DRY.

Fixes bug #1171055

Change-Id: I1a08636a6aa225da8b5d43a0bbcb9b59c057df42

[{'created': '2013-07-17 15:39:32.000000000', 'message': "Force reopening eventlet's hub after fork

With this we reopen eventlet's hub after a fork (triggered from
websockify when a new client connects) to prevent sharing epoll's fd
with the parent, which may cause erratic behaviour.

This caused novncproxy to stop working when it had more than two clients
connected.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: I3ff9001543b84b1037597da243422490bb611657
(cherry picked from commit cb25bc4530323aaa33d5c42eb01f998d463f2106)
"}]
commit_message:
Force reopening eventlet's hub after fork

With this we reopen eventlet's hub after a fork (triggered from
websockify when a new client connects) to prevent sharing epoll's fd
with the parent, which may cause erratic behaviour.

This caused novncproxy to stop working when it had more than two clients
connected.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: I3ff9001543b84b1037597da243422490bb611657
(cherry picked from commit cb25bc4530323aaa33d5c42eb01f998d463f2106)

commit_message:
Move copy_volume function to volume/utils.py.

There are several copy-pastes of running dd, so moved the most
correct one (LVM) to volume/utils.py, and also updated
BlockDeviceDriver to use it. Other drivers (e.g., NFS, GPFS, Scality)
should be updated as well. Volume migration for detached volumes
is a future use case.

Change-Id: I56c64c94eccf0a311e6f3d611738ad0403351971

commit_message:
Default to ctx user/project ID in sample POST API

Fixes bug #1202143

Avoid RPC failure when project and user IDs not explicitly
specified in POST'd sample.

Instead default to identity in current context.

Change-Id: Id1368c7ccf730bc62bc2b32247266e87482844cb
(cherry picked from commit 1d0b6397d468d8527ad3b388ee2f2b1714f3c38d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 15:53:27.000000000', 'message': "Monkeypatch and reopen eventlet's hub in novnc

eventlet.monkeypatch was not done in nova-novncproxy, but we need it in
order to do an rpc call and validate the token.

Also,With this we reopen eventlet's hub after a fork (triggered from
websockify when a new client connects) to prevent sharing epoll's fd
with the parent, which may cause erratic behaviour.

This caused novncproxy to stop working when it had more than two
clients connected.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: Ib25cb13273de807f9719bc1403684e81f5cb125e
"}]
commit_message:
Monkeypatch and reopen eventlet's hub in novnc

eventlet.monkeypatch was not done in nova-novncproxy, but we need it in
order to do an rpc call and validate the token.

Also,With this we reopen eventlet's hub after a fork (triggered from
websockify when a new client connects) to prevent sharing epoll's fd
with the parent, which may cause erratic behaviour.

This caused novncproxy to stop working when it had more than two
clients connected.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: Ib25cb13273de807f9719bc1403684e81f5cb125e

commit_message:
Deployment description is not hidden anymore

Description (i.e. the list of deployed services etc) is needed to display the configuration which was attempted to be deployed. So, this should be exposed by the API

Change-Id: I0675cd584dabc845835101192316ddd206af708d

[{'created': '2013-07-17 17:58:27.000000000', 'message': 'Delete snapshot metadata when snapshot is deleted

When a volume is deleted all rows in the volume_metadata table for that
volume are deleted as part of the database operation. This patch updates
the snapshot delete operation to delete corresponding rows in the
snapshot_metadata table.

Change-Id: I17543a82be370bed57d4165ad8756ccb390bc0d9
'}]
commit_message:
Delete snapshot metadata when snapshot is deleted

When a volume is deleted all rows in the volume_metadata table for that
volume are deleted as part of the database operation. This patch updates
the snapshot delete operation to delete corresponding rows in the
snapshot_metadata table.

Change-Id: I17543a82be370bed57d4165ad8756ccb390bc0d9

commit_message:
Port used limits extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the used limits extension and the corresponding unittests to
the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I6f1aa507ffd297e56d9cfd23972bc3bb15ba181a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 22:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Port used limits extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I34214370f53d481346eb11fec6b8fd0ddeb42918
'}, {'created': '2013-07-07 16:42:51.000000000', 'message': 'Port used limits extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files.

commit_message:
Port used limits extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I34214370f53d481346eb11fec6b8fd0ddeb42918

Fix duplicate osapi_hide_server_address_states config option

This is causing an error in the config file tool generator.
Import the config option from the v3 API copy of this code.

So this a -1 just on the commit message. Please include more details about this commit. Take a look at: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages

But, I'm not sure I see the value in this test. We already have a create test and a delete test which both essentially do the same thing as this test.(as well as some of the other tests in this file) Why do we need another test to do this, what unique feature is being tested by this. I would probably prefer to see this as an improvement to test_create_object() which doesn't do much as it sits now."}, {'account_id': 6847, 'date': '2013-06-24 21:57:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6847, 'date': '2013-06-24 22:03:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Matthew: I don't really know what more to say in the commit message, as the addition is trivial. I plan to merge create_object and delete_object to work with a non-empty file. This one would then test the empty file edge case. 

I'm also considering writing a test case where it would upload a file just under the size limit, but this could be problematic (slow, limit is settable by user, etc) and just over the limit (negative test). So this way the edge cases would be covered and an empty file is part of this."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-24 22:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

@mkollaro:
If the status code is not 201 the resource will not be cleaned up.

I agree, generally we can't delete a resource when on the server side more things are broken.
We cannot guarantee 100% resource deallocation on the fail code path, but we should follow the best effort principle and register a resource for deletion ASAP."}, {'account_id': 6847, 'date': '2013-07-10 09:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Added Swift testcase, create/remove empty object

The test case uploads an empty object, looks if it's in the container listing
and deletes it.

commit_message:
Allow Keystoneclient 0.3.x

Accept newer versions of Keystoneclient as well. Needs
newest version from ceilometerclient in order to not have
a version conflict.

Change-Id: Iae3ef6f628c589dcd684abc23ce385029d97c21e

Walls', 'email': 'jeff.walls@hpe.com', 'username': 'ftcjeff'}, {'_account_id': 7553, 'name': 'Nuno Santos', 'email': 'nuno.santos@canonical.com', 'username': 'nunosantos'}, {'_account_id': 7699, 'name': 'Jaromir Coufal', 'email': 'jcoufal@redhat.com', 'username': 'jcoufal'}, {'_account_id': 7976, 'name': 'Maxime Vidori', 'email': 'mvidori@redhat.com', 'username': 'MaxV'}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-04 10:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/1/check/gate-horizon-pep8/3644 : SUCCESS in 1m 47s

- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/1/check/gate-horizon-selenium/2365 : SUCCESS in 2m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/28549 : SUCCESS in 44m 37s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/28255 : SUCCESS in 54m 23s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/36455 : SUCCESS in 20m 29s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/14879 : FAILURE in 25m 09s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-07-04 10:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7699, 'date': '2013-07-04 11:21:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'd not better include any JS code into HTML template directly.

Code itself looks good. I'd move that among others JS sheets (horizon/static/horizon/js) and if there is no file which suits for this needs, then create new one (e.g. horizon.login.js)."}, {'account_id': 7976, 'date': '2013-07-04 11:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I based my correction on django template admin/login.html, which has the javascript right under the form tag.'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2013-07-05 01:42:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Jaromir: Instead of just implementing this on the login page. I am wondering if we should make all forms to focus on first field when it loads?'}, {'account_id': 7976, 'date': '2013-07-05 08:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We can define a class focus in the css, then in the main js file  a function which select the element and put a focus on it. So if we want to add a focus on an element, we just have to add the class on it.'}, {'account_id': 7699, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Lin: That is very good point. I'd suggest to implement this "focusing" functionality in general and use it for login first. Then create separate bug, which will ensure focus in all forms (I will go through all the forms and make sure if it makes sense in every one).

Maxim: Your suggestion with focus class makes sense. I googled a little bit and there already exists functionality in HTML 5 - autofocus attribute in tag element, which ensures what we need: http://www.w3schools.com/html/html5_form_attributes.asp. So if we don't want to reinvent wheel, we better use autofocus.'}, {'account_id': 7699, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:36:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 7699, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Based on previous comment ^^'}, {'account_id': 7976, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Okay, autofocus is a good option but the correction has to be made in the openstack_auth package (where the input widget is initialized). 

Then, if you want to had autofocus on the first input of all form, be careful of hidden inputs. For example, in login form the User Name is not the first input in the DOM.'}, {'account_id': 7976, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:35:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay I find a solution which consist in adding : 
$(':input:visible:first').focus();
Into horizon.forms javascript object. 

It will select the first visible input, textarea, select or button and put a focus on it. It's quite simple and we don't have to change any python code."}, {'account_id': 7699, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sounds reasonable for me.'}, {'account_id': 7976, 'date': '2013-07-08 15:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I put the correction into this branch or a new bug has been created for selecting the first input of every form?'}, {'account_id': 7699, 'date': '2013-07-08 15:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It was not. Feel free to add it here, since it is fixing the issue. Broader application is even better ;)'}, {'account_id': 6966, 'date': '2013-07-08 15:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like the discussion and agree that focus on the first visible field makes sense.  I also like not having the jquery directly in the HTML, but rather in a separate file if possible.'}, {'account_id': 7976, 'date': '2013-07-09 11:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-horizon-pep8/3722 : SUCCESS in 2m 25s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-horizon-docs/2583/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 6m 08s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-horizon-python26/2921 : SUCCESS in 5m 54s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-horizon-python27/2936 : SUCCESS in 3m 20s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-horizon-python27-django14/124 : SUCCESS in 4m 02s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-horizon-selenium/2443 : SUCCESS in 2m 59s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/29752 : SUCCESS in 1h 01m 25s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/29458 : SUCCESS in 48m 18s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/904 : SUCCESS in 24m 32s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35622/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/15942 : FAILURE in 16m 52s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 7553, 'date': '2013-07-09 15:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7699, 'date': '2013-07-10 07:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Maxime. The code is working very well. Unfortunately it works more than we want to. It applies focus to all screens without any difference.

The desired focus should be only in creation/edit/login forms - those views, where forms are main element to deal with. Unfortunately it applies also to elements on other views where is different purpose (e.g. Project/Overview index page, Project/Instances index page, etc).

Problem is that dropdowns for date change, filters in tables, and others are inputs as well and the function doesn't distinguish between the views. When it applies focus, the item is highlighted which is not desired on index pages for example.

Based on yesterday's discussion with David and Gabriel, it would be better if we do the change in openstack_auth with the "autofocus" HTML5 attribute.

For other forms, I'd suggest to open separate bug, go through forms and use autofocus on field which is desired to be autofocused.'}, {'account_id': 7976, 'date': '2013-07-10 13:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I made a pull request into https://github.com/gabrielhurley/django_openstack_auth/pull/48'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:50:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Please see the reasoning on the launchpad ticket. It's rare that I (ab)use my PTL power to veto a feature, but this one's not got too many possible frustrations lurking just below the surface."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-18 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-18 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Add an initial focus in login screen form

The patch will select the first visible input, textarea, select or
button and put a focus on it in every form of horizon.

Fixes bug #1185713

Change-Id: I49dd14388447c22f8761e0fd03cd8a3812801f80

commit_message:
Rework dependency injection.

This will allow use of dependant apis from class functions as well as
putting them on the instance. This changes the contract of dependencies
such that they are checked for when they are first accessed rather than
when the object is initialized.

Change-Id: I273006afb00a9147e8dbb6712a6b50b0ad7dfc88

commit_message:
raise better exception for duplicate match

When a duplicate match is found the client previously raised a
NeutronClientException which made it hard for programs using the client
to handle errors. This patch now  makes it raise a
NeutronClientNoUniqueMatch  exception instead.

Fixes bug: 1200323

Change-Id: I6ef6f9a9e257104f676dde7ec26be98417ec70e0

We recently moved away from import triggered effects, so I don't think this is a move in the right direction. It seems it would be possible to fix your problem in another way, maybe in the config system. Why does it care if options are registered several times?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-12 12:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry, oslo.config has been entirely designed that way. All projects work like that and the config generator tools expect that oslo.cfg.CONF is filled with all the config options on import (it works by importing the whole code).

So, I understand your concern and I agree with you that this is probably not optimal, but this is the Choosen Path.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-18 00:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Change-Id: If31974d7ef7fdbf85a88e950ff06c60ccbd6c31d
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}, {'created': '2013-07-11 13:50:04.000000000', 'message': "Update oslo.notifier and always register options

This avoids registering multiple times the option if the registering
functions are called multiple path by different code paths. It's
necessary for the default configuration sample generator to have options
only registered once.

The update of oslo.notifier is needed to avoid it using the inexistant
$host option.

Change-Id: If31974d7ef7fdbf85a88e950ff06c60ccbd6c31d
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}]
commit_message:
Update oslo.notifier and always register options

This avoids registering multiple times the option if the registering
functions are called multiple path by different code paths. It's
necessary for the default configuration sample generator to have options
only registered once.

The update of oslo.notifier is needed to avoid it using the inexistant
$host option.

Change-Id: If31974d7ef7fdbf85a88e950ff06c60ccbd6c31d
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Add testr run and use subunit2html with testr

This commits adds a new run option DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_TESTR_FULL
which is used to run the same tests as DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_FULL
but using testr --parallel instead of nose. This is going to eventually
be removed when using testr with tempest gets stable enough to gate
projects. But for now it will be a separate option. This also adds
support for running subunit2html on all testr runs to get pretty html
output from the testr runs.

Change-Id: I60e3ca48e8f4196503b09711997bd70e641bd16c

commit_message:
Update the Fedora element to honour --offline.

Similar to the Ubuntu element the Fedora element had not been updated
to honour --offline. Also similarly we only check for the existence of
the final cached file rather than the image we directly download,
because they are generated separately.

The -u change is just hygiene to detect future buggy changes.

Change-Id: Ib92a9d419bb485c8861da041066827e8d6aac0b7

[{'created': '2013-07-18 01:34:56.000000000', 'message': 'Enable --offline support for Ubuntu root images.

When --offline is set elements should not revalidate cached data. The
ubuntu element had not been updated to match this. SHA checking is
also skipped as we only move a new cached file into place when the
hash matches, and we might download a new hash before updating the
image cache, which would cause persistent --offline failures.

Change-Id: If1a0366b51951a73b7a3ffe23a29a3d910b08938
'}, {'created': '2013-07-18 01:34:56.000000000', 'message': 'Enable --offline support for Ubuntu root images.

When --offline is set elements should not revalidate cached data. The
ubuntu element had not been updated to match this. SHA checking is
also skipped as we only move a new cached file into place when the
hash matches, and we might download a new hash before updating the
image cache, which would cause persistent --offline failures.

Change-Id: If1a0366b51951a73b7a3ffe23a29a3d910b08938
'}]
commit_message:
Enable --offline support for Ubuntu root images.

When --offline is set elements should not revalidate cached data. The
ubuntu element had not been updated to match this. SHA checking is
also skipped as we only move a new cached file into place when the
hash matches, and we might download a new hash before updating the
image cache, which would cause persistent --offline failures.

Change-Id: If1a0366b51951a73b7a3ffe23a29a3d910b08938

option processing. Untested code is broken code!

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 11:02:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'glance-cache-manage list-cached' for xattr

The xattr driver for the caching middleware was returning it's
last_modified/last_accessed times in iso8601 format rather than a
timestamp.

This was inconsistent with the sqlite driver and caused the
glance-cache-manage command to fall over when using the xattr driver.

Fixes bug 1197360

Change-Id: Ie72dcd9f41f7a3b7405cda9fe28e1e468fcc1bef
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'glance-cache-manage list-cached' for xattr

The xattr driver for the caching middleware was returning it's
last_modified/last_accessed times in iso8601 format rather than a
timestamp.

This was inconsistent with the sqlite driver and caused the
glance-cache-manage command to fall over when using the xattr driver.

Fixes bug 1197360

Change-Id: Ie72dcd9f41f7a3b7405cda9fe28e1e468fcc1bef

commit_message:
Fix issue with V3 Authentication.

Unscoped token does not have a roles attribute in it. Fix the
code to handle non-existent of roles in the Auth Token.

Fixes: bug #1202385

Change-Id: I2bd101e3ed2dd37da86f84773c2b9dafc0717d3b

commit_message:
Fix shelve's use of system_metadata

The shelve patches needed to include a hack to make the changes
to system_metadata get saved properly. Now that it's fixed,
clean that up.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I79a2db66544e0662e48445505a818ff62f765569

[{'created': '2013-07-16 01:58:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Instance object handling of implied fields

The situation around info_cache and security_groups is a bit
confusing and inconsistent at the moment. Since some of the
"all" queries don't join info_cache and security_groups,
avoid assuming that they are there, either triggering an
unintentional lazy load, or a KeyError in a few cases where the
DB API returns a dict.

Also, don't ever allow us to recurse into another instance object
looking for a loaded attribute in case it fails to load from the
get query.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

commit_message:
Fix Instance object handling of implied fields

The situation around info_cache and security_groups is a bit
confusing and inconsistent at the moment. Since some of the
"all" queries don't join info_cache and security_groups,
avoid assuming that they are there, either triggering an
unintentional lazy load, or a KeyError in a few cases where the
DB API returns a dict.

Also, don't ever allow us to recurse into another instance object
looking for a loaded attribute in case it fails to load from the
get query.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I40b72274cd24034b03c8e07af56e7c8d49b6b898

commit_message:
Make Instance object properly update *metadata

Currently, the Instance object won't notice when metadata or
system_metadata has changed and thus won't include it in updates it
makes to the database.

We could make these two dicts full-fledged objects, but that's a bit
overkill for this purpose. Stash a copy of them every time we reset
our changes so that we can detect changes in save().

Note that this includes tests to some shelve tests which are now
wrong because they modify the instance's sys_meta prematurely.
Turns out, these are the tests that pointed out the need for
this tracking :)

Related to blueprint unified-object-model
Fixes bug 1201776

Change-Id: I3df462645979742379a41060cda5bb5084fddb20

commit_message:
Match identity driver authenticate_user signature

The identity driver base class defined authenticate_user like

 def authenticate_user(self, user_id, password):

but all the subclasses define it like

 def authenticate_user(self, user_id=None, password=None):

This change makes the base definition the same as the subclasses
to help avoid confusion for those implementing their own driver.

Change-Id: Ide8ab4ebf28d589c876940cf5cdc915e992a7d59

commit_message:
Match identity driver authorize_for_project signature

The identity driver base class defined authorize_for_project like

 def authorize_for_project(self, tenant_id, user_ref):

but all the subclasses define it like

 def authorize_for_project(self, user_ref, tenant_id=None):

This change makes the base definition the same as the subclasses
to help avoid confusion for those implementing their own driver.

Change-Id: Ia534b0e2ad67c3a2924f55a43655e2925f01d06f

[{'created': '2013-07-17 11:39:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix extend_volume error handling.

If the async call to the manager/driver failed, the API still updated
the quota and volume size in the DB. Solution is to move these tasks
down to the manager, where we know if the extend succeeded.

Change-Id: I668fd659830bd6d410be64a1f5116377b08a9e96
Fixes: bug 1201814
'}]
commit_message:
Fix extend_volume error handling.

If the async call to the manager/driver failed, the API still updated
the quota and volume size in the DB. Solution is to move these tasks
down to the manager, where we know if the extend succeeded.

Change-Id: I668fd659830bd6d410be64a1f5116377b08a9e96
Fixes: bug 1201814

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 18:21:12.000000000', 'message': "Instance node not updated on evacuate

The evacuate API works like a migration from a dead node. As part of
migration, the instance.node property is updated to reflect the target
node that the instance is migrating to. This is later used when the
migration is confirmed/reverted.  The problem is when an instance is
being evacuated, the node property isn't getting updated and the
instance will have the old (dead) node value set on it after it's
evacuated.  This patch updates instance.node when the instance is
evacuated.

Fixes bug 1198284

Change-Id: I4901fb937160e955df7c97c37265783e844fdbef
"}, {'created': '2013-07-06 01:34:41.000000000', 'message': "Update instance.node on evacuate

The evacuate API works like a migration from a dead node. As part of

Fixes bug 1198284

Change-Id: I4901fb937160e955df7c97c37265783e844fdbef
"}, {'created': '2013-07-06 20:18:58.000000000', 'message': "Update instance.node on evacuate

The evacuate API works like a migration from a dead node. As part of
migration, the instance.node property is updated to reflect the target
node that the instance is migrating to. This is later used when the
migration is confirmed/reverted. The problem is when an instance is
being evacuated, the node property isn't getting updated and the

Fixes bug 1198284

Change-Id: I4901fb937160e955df7c97c37265783e844fdbef
"}]
commit_message:
Update instance.node on evacuate

The evacuate API works like a migration from a dead node. As part of
migration, the instance.node property is updated to reflect the target
node that the instance is migrating to. This is later used when the
migration is confirmed/reverted. The problem is when an instance is
being evacuated, the node property isn't getting updated and the
instance will have the old (dead) node value set on it after it's
evacuated. This patch updates instance.node when the instance is
evacuated.

Fixes bug 1198284

Change-Id: I4901fb937160e955df7c97c37265783e844fdbef

commit_message:
Switch to using testr as the test runner for everything non-gating.

This commit switches the test runner in tempest to testr from nose for all
jobs that aren't gating. This will allow the usage of parallel testing with
the use of a group_regex in testr. Group_regex will ensure that the classes
get scheduled together and the run times are tracked together. Than the
tools/run_test_classes.py script will filter the test_ids and pass only the
classes to subunit.run to ensure we are only running setupClass once.

This commit also adds a new option to run_tests.sh. -t/--with-testr can be
used to optionally run tempest in parallel with testr. Once running with
testr gets stable enough this will become the default for run_tests.

It also adds a testr-full tox job so we can have a tracking non-voting job
that runs the same tests as the gate but with testr.

Implements: blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: Iedc9bd92b8f8471c60c614c7d7c05046d7b32743

[{'created': '2013-07-17 21:40:46.000000000', 'message': "Document an interface for offline operation.

Complex image builds can download hundreds of MB of data from the
internet with many separate lookups. It would be nice to allow users
to ask for a fast build where those lookups are entirely avoided,
using locally cached resources (where possible). This new interface
allows users to signal to elements that they wish to operate without
updating cached resources, which will in turn allow us to avoid
checking for stale data at all.

As part of this I've also documented where we cache data, so that
things like the ccache cache dir and image cache files are not a
surprise to users.

Change-Id: I27f5de6ceaa4e9c6390721b7c434fe0908df84f5
"}]
commit_message:
Document an interface for offline operation.

Complex image builds can download hundreds of MB of data from the
internet with many separate lookups. It would be nice to allow users
to ask for a fast build where those lookups are entirely avoided,
using locally cached resources (where possible). This new interface
allows users to signal to elements that they wish to operate without
updating cached resources, which will in turn allow us to avoid
checking for stale data at all.

As part of this I've also documented where we cache data, so that
things like the ccache cache dir and image cache files are not a
surprise to users.

Change-Id: I27f5de6ceaa4e9c6390721b7c434fe0908df84f5

[{'created': '2013-07-17 15:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Standardize on X-Project-Id over X-Tenant-Id.

Both X-Project-Id and X-Tenant-Id headers are set to the
same value by the keystoneclient authtoken middleware.

However the latter is deprecated, so instead of referring to
a mix of the two headers, we standardize on X-Project-Id.

Change-Id: I0fcdc1944ea12d0e997627c5740b57a0bd58dbe8
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize on X-Project-Id over X-Tenant-Id.

Both X-Project-Id and X-Tenant-Id headers are set to the
same value by the keystoneclient authtoken middleware.

However the latter is deprecated, so instead of referring to
a mix of the two headers, we standardize on X-Project-Id.

Change-Id: I0fcdc1944ea12d0e997627c5740b57a0bd58dbe8

commit_message:
Fix relative imports and namespace issues.

os_apply_config.os_apply_config caused confusing import problems.
Renaming it to os_apply_config.apply_config solves this. Now we can be
explicit about all imports.

Change-Id: I7b0c5fe18e27e16b5db73e30480de865a332b8d2

[{'created': '2013-07-17 21:07:56.000000000', 'message': 'Adding MANIFEST.in and fixing .gitreview

Bit-rot from no development going on has led to some problems. The
.gitrview file points at the old named repo. MANIFEST.in is needed to
make sure we have README.md to satisfy setup.cfg using it for the long
description.

Change-Id: I9ba5b2c1eda349b26d24833ebd5cbd5244584311
'}]
commit_message:
Adding MANIFEST.in and fixing .gitreview

Bit-rot from no development going on has led to some problems. The
.gitrview file points at the old named repo. MANIFEST.in is needed to
make sure we have README.md to satisfy setup.cfg using it for the long
description.

Change-Id: I9ba5b2c1eda349b26d24833ebd5cbd5244584311

commit_message:
Add show limits command

* This is a combination of the compute and volume API limits as they are
  very similar.  As such, the command lives in a new command group
  'openstack.common' that is unversioned.
* Implements 'limits show [--absolute|--rate]

Updated for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36772/

Bug: 1172057

Change-Id: I2bd181cd0d098f7143360ae67944c2f221379af5

This is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33782/ (split 4 of 4)'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-07-10 09:59:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:12:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Boris,

This approach was taken because we need all the instances in order to properly implement policy checking: we need to loop through each instance with check_policy(context, 'get_all_instance_metadata', instance).

Approach 0: Remove the policy checking entirely / mock up the check_policy target with data from the context / etc. I think we have quite a few places in the code where this happens (like compute.api.get_all). This seems like the wrong thing to do, but it is the easiest. :)

Approach 1 (I took in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33782/5 (patch set 5)): add an additional get_all call, link the metadata to the associated instance and call check_policy. After IRC discussion with Chris Behrens I tried the next approach.

Approach 2: Call _get_instances_by_filters, you get the metadata for free. And the metadata filters are implemented already, but they remove instances from the list, not metadata. So I needed to add a special filter keyword to let the methods to not only return just filtered instances, but also filter on the metadata as well when this path is called.

I could modify this approach to make it cleaner (but maybe it would be slower?)

Approach 3?: Call _get_instances_by_filters but filter the metadata in python in compute.api rather than adding functionality to the SQLalchemy tag filters.

Let me know thoughts .."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-07-10 17:56:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I think this should be done with the InstanceList object, and in a non-sqlalchemy way."}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-07-11 04:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-07-11 04:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

Stephen - after reading it a few more times and checking the example, I think you're right and this is not quite right.  The API definition of "filter" is .. ugly.

I'll file a fresh bug and start writing a patch.'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-07-17 19:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

and now that I've spent some time banging on it, I've changed my mind again -- no bug.

 I think we're actually doing the right thing. I was fooled by an older euca2ools that wasn't actually generating the right DescribeTags query from euca-describe-tags (be careful !) I grabbed a bleeding-edge version of that and boto just in case.

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeTags.html

Take the example for "all your instances tagged with either stack=test or stack=Production".

$ euca-create-tags --tag stack=Production i-0000003 && euca-create-tags --tag stack=Production i-0000004
$ euca-describe-tags --filter "resource-type=instance" --filter="key=stack" --filter "value=Production" --filter "value=Test"
TAG     i-00000004      instance        stack   Production
TAG     i-00000003      instance        stack   Test

This works because of the filter values get passed in as a list, and the code in _filter_metadata checks that condition.

Sorry for the confusion -- and if you find use cases that are broken, file a bug and assign to me and I'll hunt it down. I think there's a condition in _filter_metadata that actually doesn't get called: (if key and value), because of the way the filters are built for DescribeTags (unlike DescribeInstances).
I'll clean that up at some point.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 15:37:41.000000000', 'message': "Change get_all_instance_metadata to use _get_instances_by_filters

We need an instance list for invoking check_policy against when calling
get_all_instance_metadata. Since the get_instances call also returns
the associated instance metadata, we can reuse this code.

The filters passed from DescribeTags are transformed to ones that
_get_instances_by_filters understands. By including 'remove_metadata'
in the filter, _get_instances_by_filters will not only filter
out instances that don't pass the metadata filter, but also remove
the associated instance metadata, which is what the higher-level DescribeTags
call would need.

We then loop through the instances and return the already-filtered metadata
for the instances that pass the policy check.

Fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: Idb005b7227447308a8d060be7aa9ff5c70b5ff44
"}, {'created': '2013-07-09 17:27:52.000000000', 'message': "Change get_all_instance_metadata to use _get_instances_by_filters

We need an instance list for invoking check_policy against when calling
get_all_instance_metadata. Since the get_instances call also returns
the associated instance metadata, we can reuse this code.

The filters passed from DescribeTags are transformed to ones that
_get_instances_by_filters understands. By including 'remove_metadata'
in the filter, _get_instances_by_filters will not only filter
out instances that don't pass the metadata filter, but also remove
the associated instance metadata, which is what the higher-level DescribeTags
call would need.

We then loop through the instances and return the already-filtered metadata
for the instances that pass the policy check.

Fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: Idb005b7227447308a8d060be7aa9ff5c70b5ff44

commit_message:
Change get_all_instance_metadata to use _get_instances_by_filters

We need an instance list for invoking check_policy against when calling
get_all_instance_metadata. Since the _get_instances_by_filters
call also returns associated instance metadata, we can use this instead
of db.api.get_all_instance_metadata.

Fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: Idb005b7227447308a8d060be7aa9ff5c70b5ff44

commit_message:
update requires to prevent version cap

OpenStack clients requirements should not have an upper bound
as that has implications for testing in the gate.

ref: https://github.com/openstack/requirements

fixes bug #1200214
Change-Id: I45c8e94ede892a4d5412ac43aae9c4e131907c89

commit_message:
Alwas set model = 'netfront' for xen over libvirt.

This will prevent emulated network driver to be attached to virtual machine.
Emulated network driver is not working for xen over libvirt as tap interface
name is suffixed by xen with '-emu' which makes this interface name to long.

Additionaly security groups will not also work for this interface as openstack
is setting up filters on interface without -emu suffix.

Change-Id: I156ca3422ca4e6c4afe2eaa1aec10f0bb86238d6
Fixes: bug #1202199

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 10:24:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes race condition in LVMVolumeDriver create_cloned_volume method

When we create a clone volume, LVMVolumeDriver will firstly create a temp
snapshot for copying, the temp snapshot name is
"clone-snap-%s" % source_volume['id']. When we create multiple clone volumes
of the same volume simultaneously, which would trigger the race issuse.

I changes the temp snapshot name template to "clone-snap-%s" % volume['id'],
so temp snapshot name will be unique.

Fixes bug #1202139

Change-Id: I3a4f2585ea9e6f70b6f6f9889e900f19559b8176
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race condition in LVMVolumeDriver create_cloned_volume method

When we create a clone volume, LVMVolumeDriver will firstly create a temp
snapshot for copying, the temp snapshot name is
"clone-snap-%s" % source_volume['id']. When we create multiple clone volumes
of the same volume simultaneously, which would trigger the race issuse.

I changes the temp snapshot name template to "clone-snap-%s" % volume['id'],
so temp snapshot name will be unique.

Fixes bug #1202139

Change-Id: I3a4f2585ea9e6f70b6f6f9889e900f19559b8176

commit_message:
Prompt error message when creating aggregate without aggregate name

When using API to create an availability zone via aggregate, the
prompt message will be "There was a conflict when trying to complete
your request" if the request body looks like below.
{"aggregate": {"name": "", "availability_zone": "zy1_zone53335"}}

The message is not accurate, aggregate name should not be null.

Fixes bug 1188032
Change-Id: I1fb74186886283a9b6763abb665b8ce42e4bb24c

The above part just was a workaround.

The _GONE is waiting for termination. 
FIXME: The termination does not need be shown for forever.
IMHO the instance considered terminated, when it does not prevent security group deletion, and does not calculated into the quota.

The other aspect of termination is all resource consumed by the VM is freed. (instance memory, storage , ...)'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-06-15 09:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-05 14:00:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Do not merge

There is a whole lot going on here, which makes it very hard to review.  I think you'll have a *much* easier time getting these changes merged if you break it up into a bunch of small pieces.  Also, provide references to the EC2 spec where appropriate.  That will make all of this much easier on reviewers and will let you get it merged piece by piece.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6717, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

All that is going on here is making EC2 API exceptions and code that handles them sane exactly as described in blueprint referenced in commit message. This patch does exactly and only that and can't be split without breaking context. Most of changes are simple renames of exceptions. New code is covered by new unit tests."}, {'account_id': 5371, 'date': '2013-07-11 21:20:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a lot of changes to an API in one commit. It definitely needs to be broken into multiple patches, maybe one per API resource or something."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-07-11 21:52:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Do not merge

Wow, yeah, this is a lot of stuff all in one patch.

I think I'd like to see things broken up by type of change. You've got some consolidation/cleanup things that all fall into a specific template, you've got some cases where you're changing the type of exception raised, some cases where you're changing how the exception is caught, handled, etc.

Those cases all really should be separate patches, IMHO."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 08:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

The current EC2 API support status.. how to say it politely. "Not good."

This change could improve a lot of thing, but it is risky if it is difficult to review.

I am not sure what is worse, not fixing those issues or fixing it in a big patch.
I would vote to the first one.

Most part of the change is relatively simple.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-07-15 13:39:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

FWIW - I also agree that this change does not need to be split up - but I don't think it would be a huge problem to do so."}, {'account_id': 6717, 'date': '2013-07-17 18:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Abandoned

I split this change as requested into two patches which is max without breaking context too much:
1) https://review.openstack.org/37548
2) https://review.openstack.org/37549

Unrelated but required malformed format string fix is already merged:
https://review.openstack.org/37243/'}]

[{'created': '2013-05-06 17:54:35.000000000', 'message': 'Improve EC2 API error responses.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-codes

Proper EC2 error codes are returned where possible.

Redundant logging code was united in new ec2_error_ex() helper function and
all standard EC2 error responses are now uniformly logged on DEBUG log level
because they are just responses to invalid client requests, not nova errors.

Unexpected client/server errors are logged on ERROR/CRITICAL level and their
exception name is used as error code - no more useless UnknownError. Error
descriptions are supressed for unexpected server errors as they might contain
sensitive data.

EC2APIError was removed and replaced by specific exceptions. New EC2
exceptions were introduced with EC2 suffix, some of them contain
_ (underscores) in place of . (dots) for automatic translation from exception
name to EC2 error code. This way, no new exception arguments were needed.

Change-Id: I434ab63eae4eb49a45aff671a79ba3c488220cea

commit_message:
Improve EC2 API error responses.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-codes

Proper EC2 error codes are returned where possible.

Redundant logging code was united in new ec2_error_ex() helper function
and all standard EC2 error responses are now uniformly logged on DEBUG
log level because they are just responses to invalid client requests,
not nova errors. New unit tests are provided.

Unexpected client/server errors are logged on ERROR/CRITICAL level and
their exception name is used as error code - no more useless
UnknownError. Error descriptions are supressed for unexpected server
errors as they might contain sensitive information.

EC2APIError was removed and replaced by specific exceptions. New EC2
exceptions were introduced with ec2_code attribute providing the EC2
error code.

Also fixed malformed error message in compute/api.py that broke the
tests.

Change-Id: I434ab63eae4eb49a45aff671a79ba3c488220cea

commit_message:
Add swift::bench to manage swift-bench.conf

This patch adds a conf file swift-bench.conf
for swift performance bench, and add a spec
test for it.

Fixed bug 1188968

Change-Id: Iafb67f116a9403bba96328be7c9c09d21a65a74c

subject: Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS
messages: [{'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nSorry this is mistake'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 17:34:46.000000000', 'message': 'Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

This patch implements reference driver implementation for VPNaaS.
The driver uses strongswan to manage vpn connections.

Future work:
VPN connection status update by actual status
Support ikepolicy and ipsec update
Support multiple driver
Support service type framework

This patch will add Jinja2 for dependencies. Jinja2 is a template library
used to generate strongswan config files.

This patch introduces neutron-netns-wrapper command.
- Multiple instances of Strongswan cannot be launched in the same host "as is",
  because the locations of its configuration,  pid and control socket file
  are hard coded.
  In addition,  since Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace
  using "ip netns" command,  it needs to run in a mount namespace created
  by this command.
- The solution is to use a wrapper that bind-mount the required directories
  in a separate folder. This mount will only affect the subprocess launched
  by the wrapper.
- This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
  be used to run unauthorized commands as root.
- The wrapper can be launched as follow:

ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
  --cmd "ipsec,start" \
  --mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
  --rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I33c0b9b079f320b0a3e741c93a7735547cb61b7d
'}]
commit_message:
Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

This patch implements reference driver implementation for VPNaaS.
The driver uses strongswan to manage vpn connections.

Future work:
VPN connection status update by actual status
Support ikepolicy and ipsec update
Support multiple driver
Support service type framework

This patch will add Jinja2 for dependencies. Jinja2 is a template library
used to generate strongswan config files.

This patch introduces neutron-netns-wrapper command.
- Multiple instances of Strongswan cannot be launched in the same host "as is",
  because the locations of its configuration,  pid and control socket file
  are hard coded.
  In addition,  since Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace
  using "ip netns" command,  it needs to run in a mount namespace created
  by this command.
- The solution is to use a wrapper that bind-mount the required directories
  in a separate folder. This mount will only affect the subprocess launched
  by the wrapper.
- This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
  be used to run unauthorized commands as root.
- The wrapper can be launched as follow:

ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
  --cmd "ipsec,start" \
  --mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
  --rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I33c0b9b079f320b0a3e741c93a7735547cb61b7d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 11:05:07.000000000', 'message': 'Only create swift account if swift enabled

Only call the swift account creation function if swift is enabled,
otherwise the endpoints are created in keystone even though swift
isn't running.

This causes failures when tempest queries keystone and thinks swift is
there; it starts running tests against it that fail with unhelpful
"connection refused" errors.

Change-Id: Icf08409c9443ec703e5f1da4531aa34c326f3642
'}]
commit_message:
Only create swift account if swift enabled

Only call the swift account creation function if swift is enabled,
otherwise the endpoints are created in keystone even though swift
isn't running.

This causes failures when tempest queries keystone and thinks swift is
there; it starts running tests against it that fail with unhelpful
"connection refused" errors.

Change-Id: Icf08409c9443ec703e5f1da4531aa34c326f3642

commit_message:
Fix accessing to '/' of metadata server without any checks to work

Accessing to '/' of metadata server to get version information should
be allowed without any checks. Due to the wrong comparison condition,
it failed.

Change-Id: Ia8603c321839b959b120af1d018f061f438155c7
Fixes: bug #1192774

subject: Restrict use of 'plain_text' to 'text/plain' MIME
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37338/1/check/gate-barbican-pyflakes/38 : SUCCESS in 7s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37338/1/check/gate-barbican-pep8/38 : SUCCESS in 9s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37338/1/check/gate-barbican-python27/38 : SUCCESS in 1m 46s
'}, {'account_id': 7789, 'date': '2013-07-16 22:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(4 inline comments)

The overall issue here is that we only support 'text/plain' mime-types when 'plain_text' is provided on a secrets POST. 

So this is purely a validation issue, and should therefore be fixed only in the validation code. So when 'plain-text' is supplied, the only valid 'mime_type' value is 'text/plain'. Any other 'mime_type' should return an 'exception.InvalidObject()' exception (which translates to a response code of 400).

So I think after line 112 in validators.py, there should be a check to see if the 'mime_type' is not 'text/plain'...if that is true then an 'InvalidObject' exception should be thrown with a message like "Only 'text/plain' supported when 'plain_text' specified".'}, {'account_id': 8133, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7789, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Thanks Arash, looks good.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-16 21:58:06.000000000', 'message': 'Handle exceptions caused by invalid plain text

When creating a secret of 'mime_type' "application/octet-stream"
with supplied 'plain_text', a ValueError would be thrown during
the encryption step. This resulted in a 500 HTTP status. Now, the
exception is properly handled and 415 status code is returned.

Fixes: bug #1200659
Change-Id: I9df8ec52c96c6cbe63c1f1af85e9a60ef507ff69
'}, {'created': '2013-07-17 16:56:33.000000000', 'message': "Restrict use of 'plain_text' to 'text/plain' MIME

When creating a secret with a non 'text/plain' MIME type with
supplied 'plain_text', a ValueError would be thrown during the
encryption step. This resulted in a 500 HTTP status. Now when
a create secret request is sent with a 'plain_text' field
provided and a non 'text/plain' MIME type, a 400 HTTP status
is returned.

Fixes: bug #1200659
Change-Id: I9df8ec52c96c6cbe63c1f1af85e9a60ef507ff69
"}]
commit_message:
Restrict use of 'plain_text' to 'text/plain' MIME

When creating a secret with a non 'text/plain' MIME type with
supplied 'plain_text', a ValueError would be thrown during the
encryption step. This resulted in a 500 HTTP status. Now when
a create secret request is sent with a 'plain_text' field
provided and a non 'text/plain' MIME type, a 400 HTTP status
is returned.

Fixes: bug #1200659
Change-Id: I9df8ec52c96c6cbe63c1f1af85e9a60ef507ff69

commit_message:
Checks the volume_clear flag and just return if it is none

Refactors the clear_volume method in LVMVolumeDriver, checks the
volume_clear flag firstly and return directly if it is none.

Change-Id: Id2523cfaaf61c7d6dec51c0daf6255d9de5d50f3

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-17 12:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5055, 'date': '2013-07-17 12:09:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, this works for me, but considering the auth project check in the samples loop:

if auth_project and auth_project != s.project_id

is it better to use auth_project instead of pecan.request.headers.get('X-Project-Id')?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-17 13:43:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Guangyu Suo: thanks for the review! That auth_project logic only kicks in when two things hold:

1. the user is non-admin

2. the user has *explicitly specified another project_id in the sample that does not match their own tenant ID

Since this fix only applies to the case where the user and project IDs are *not* specified in a sample, the auth_project is not relevant (as it will always equal the X-Project-Id for non-admin users, or None for admin)

So the only issue in my mind is whether our inconsistent references to X-Tenant-Id in some places:

  https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/api/acl.py#L55

and X-Project-Id in others:

  https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py#L818

is an issue.

The keystoneclient authtoken middleware currently sets both headers, but X-Tenant-Id is marked deprecated so I guess we should really standardize on X-Project-Id.

I'll submit a separate patch for this.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-17 15:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-17 15:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Guangyu Suo: that separate patch I mentioned earlier:

  https://review.openstack.org/37501'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-17 15:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 15:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Fixes bug #1202143

specified in POST'd sample.

Instead default to identity in current context.

Change-Id: Id1368c7ccf730bc62bc2b32247266e87482844cb
"}, {'created': '2013-07-17 15:16:50.000000000', 'message': "Default to ctx user/project ID in sample POST API

specified in POST'd sample.

Instead default to identity in current context.

Change-Id: Id1368c7ccf730bc62bc2b32247266e87482844cb
"}]
commit_message:
Default to ctx user/project ID in sample POST API

Fixes bug #1202143

Avoid RPC failure when project and user IDs not explicitly
specified in POST'd sample.

Instead default to identity in current context.

Change-Id: Id1368c7ccf730bc62bc2b32247266e87482844cb

commit_message:
Cluster scaling: deletion

Inmplemented:
* exclude/include files mechanism is implemented
* adding instances was change
* removing instances works ok
* "slaves" and "masters" are deleted

Implements blueprint delete-instances
Implements blueprint get-rid-of-slaves-file
Fixes: bug #1199884

Change-Id: Ie1bfaa421fce22efd3115ba13758932b6b592d7a

'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-09 23:13:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

looks good.

discussion point: i think there is another way to do this. my understanding of oslo RPC dispatcher is it's design for multiple RPC api versions or namespaces (https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py#L47) which we currently don't utilise. 

i personally would like to see the publisher choosing the 'outlet' (ie. standard rpc, having a configurable procedure call instead of hardcoded to 'record_metering_data') and a single dispatcher sending it to appropriate method... as oppose to a single publisher and multiple single target dispatchers.

leaving no score since this solution is valid and works fine."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-09 23:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Multiple dispatcher enablement

Ceilometer does not allow multiple dispatchers to be configured.
With this implementation, a deployment can be configured to have
multiple dispatchers to direct the meters to database and other
outlet.

blueprint multi-dispatcher-enablement

Change-Id: I68c731f65d198d4fa1220f75752f242e74355dfe

commit_message:
Add a check script

It can be used to periodically test that each node is reachable
over ssh.  If not, the node is deleted.

Fixes bug: 1130414

Change-Id: If3945342e83dc7d05c6384244dd6306071c8eca0

commit_message:
Add logging and retry label change

Sometimes the label change HTTP request can fail; in those cases,
try 3 times 5 seconds apart, and then log the error.

Change-Id: Ifab68c91b89edfc5b441cbcabd1035efdc3a148e

"The first commit line is the most important.
In GIT commits the first line of the commit message has special significance. It is used as email subject line, git annotate messages, gitk viewer annotations, merge commit messages and many more places where space is at a premium. As well as summarizing the change itself, it should take care to detail what part of the code is affected. eg if it affects the libvirt driver, mention 'libvirt' somewhere in the first line."  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Information_in_commit_messages

So the title should contain the word powervm somewhere'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-17 00:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Do not merge

commit_message:
Fix blocking issue when powervm calculate checksum

In powervm driver, it takes long time to calculate file checksum
before and after transferring image file. Because nova-compute is
a single thread, it won't process any other work at the same time.
Here give other threads chance to run by using time.sleep(0), that
acts as a yield of the thread for eventlet.

Fixes bug #1181895

Change-Id: I79fbd9d7d4fb7791ca599b136cf9945dec8996e2

commit_message:
Move resource usage sync functions to db backend

Resource usage sync functions was declared in nova/quota.py, and
using db.api public methods. This functions was moved to database
backend implementation, so now sync functions can use private
methods of database backend, and session attribute can be removed
from this public methods, and even some public methods can be removed.

Blueprint: db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: I63eeb18b8ede4b4263ee553d4e70633de463e0c4

commit_message:
Add a VIF driver for IOVisor engine

Implements blueprint iovisor-vif-driver

Unit Test is included
Follows the same structure that OVS and Qbh drivers
Includes the rootwrap config to allow calls to ifc-ctl for managing IOVisor engine.

Change-Id: I346b4d84a6e48d56f307349ed681355d26710ecd

Status description is set on errors

If cluster comes into Error state, status_description field would contain
information about the error,

Implements blueprint expose-cluster-errors-details

Change-Id: I6ac629db331515ba8f5ef02b39852b6be9f592c9

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-07-17 14:02:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Arguably this is a bug in the eventlet module - it should set O_CLOEXEC  on the epoll FD, so that it isn't leaked into the child process. Alternatively you could claim it is a bug in multiprocessing for not closing all open file descriptors when fork+exec the child process.

I'm happy with this workaround, but IMHO a bug ought to be filed against eventlet at least."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 14:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 08:09:34.000000000', 'message': "Force reseting eventlet's epoll hub after fork

With this we recreate the hub after a fork when using epoll and prevent
the child process to inherit and use the epoll file descriptor from the
parent process.

This caused that when more than two processes were sharing the same hub
(and the same epoll fd), those processes weren't able to process the
events in the sockets as they should, causing the whole epoll system to
work erratically and, in this case, hang the VNC data flow.

It is recommended that when forking a epoll-based process to not share
the epoll instance between them to prevent such problems.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: I3ff9001543b84b1037597da243422490bb611657
"}, {'created': '2013-07-17 12:54:10.000000000', 'message': "Force reopening eventlet's hub after fork

With this we reopen eventlet's hub after a fork (triggered from
websockify when a new client connects) to prevent sharing epoll's fd
with the parent, which may cause erratic behaviour.

This caused novncproxy to stop working when it had more than two clients
connected.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: I3ff9001543b84b1037597da243422490bb611657
"}]
commit_message:
Force reopening eventlet's hub after fork

With this we reopen eventlet's hub after a fork (triggered from
websockify when a new client connects) to prevent sharing epoll's fd
with the parent, which may cause erratic behaviour.

This caused novncproxy to stop working when it had more than two clients
connected.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: I3ff9001543b84b1037597da243422490bb611657

commit_message:
Make String column creation compatible with SQLAlchemy 0.8

3 migration scripts used the convert_unicode, unicode_error, and
_warn_on_bytestring arguments when creating String columns.  These
seem to cause problems with SQLAlchemy 0.8.  Nova excised all use
of such arguments in commit 93dec58156e when squashing migrations
for Grizzly, and seems to have no problems with SQLAlchemy 0.8.

Fixes bug 1199453

Change-Id: Ie4b46339423e6a1ad3d8ca699a2412b825206c0e

commit_message:
Support scoped keys in aggregate extra specs filter

Update AggregateInstanceExtraSpecs to support scoped keys in flavor
extra_specs.  Otherwise, you can't use this filter in combination with
other filters that act on un-scoped extra specs, because they may
conflict.

This recently came up on the mailing list:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-July/011421.html

Fix bug 1198290.

DocImpact - See updates to filter_scheduler.rst.

Change-Id: I03d1d3268c800dc6982ffa4b13f8b9489428b991

commit_message:
Creating cluter w/o cluster template fixed

Now user will recieve an error message, saying that Cluster
could not be created w/o node groups.

Fixes bug 1200601

Change-Id: If97c561c6e5771eb8d84edf0b468ddd475ff6e98

commit_message:
Fix version and location of heat doc build

pbr injects version information as part of the build_sphinx command,
so having it here is overkill.

Change-Id: I1f89e068da3e47b94434cb71db87704f9665dea2
