commit_message:
storage: fix clear/upgrade order

With the current order, when using MongoDB, the indexes are created on
connection, but clear() drop the database with the indexes just after,
meaning we have no indexes! Let's fix that by upgrading (so we're sure we
have tables or the like), then clearing data, then upgrading again so we're
sure we have our tables or indexes.

Change-Id: Ib3550f26ac0507c781a5e82573a789b2513ae04c

[{'created': '2013-07-16 07:18:15.000000000', 'message': 'Disable fallocate and set max_file_size to default

- We used to set max_file_size to 10000 to get the functional tests
  passing on devstack but this was the wrong way. We are now disabling
  fallocate like done in saio to get the large objects test passing.
- Fixes bug 1201077.

Change-Id: I33058352f5abfb06f2a992890cbc7339cedc0ad3
'}]
commit_message:
Disable fallocate and set max_file_size to default

- We used to set max_file_size to 10000 to get the functional tests
  passing on devstack but this was the wrong way. We are now disabling
  fallocate like done in saio to get the large objects test passing.
- Fixes bug 1201077.

Change-Id: I33058352f5abfb06f2a992890cbc7339cedc0ad3

just change the LOG method from info to debug in places where produce

Fixes: bug 1192170

When setting verbose=True, the log level will be set to INFO, so we

commit_message:
Lose weight for Ceilometer log in verbose mode

When setting verbose=True, the log level will be set to INFO, so we
just change the LOG method from info to debug in places where produce
heavily output.

If want to get debug level logs, set debug=True in ceilometer.conf.

Change-Id: I06e1f06340a2e7b782d3c7461ea86b629dadf05d
Fixes: bug 1192170

Fixes bug 1191007

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 07:55:37.000000000', 'message': "publisher.rpc: queing policies

This change allow to configure the behavior of rpc publisher
when rabbitmq is down.

3 policies are available:
- block: wait until it comes back
- drop: don't publish the samples
- queue: create a local queue of 'max_queue_length' samples

The default is block

Configuration of the policy is done via the publisher url
example: rpc://?policy=queue&max_queue_length=100

Change-Id: I41c9be9e1c760db1155711325434a1877e6dd7b2
Fixes: bug#1192918
"}, {'created': '2013-07-04 08:14:08.000000000', 'message': "publisher.rpc: queing policies

commit_message:
publisher.rpc: queing policies

This change allow to configure the behavior of rpc publisher
when rabbitmq is down.

3 policies are available:
- default: wait until it comes back if rabbit_max_retries <= 0
           raise a exception if rabbit_max_retries > 0
- drop: don't publish the samples
- queue: create a local queue of 'max_queue_length' samples

Configuration of the policy is done via the publisher url
example: rpc://?policy=queue&max_queue_length=100

Change-Id: I41c9be9e1c760db1155711325434a1877e6dd7b2
Fixes: bug#1192918 bug#1189488

commit_message:
Add support to allow tilde's in REPOPATH

Up to now only paths begining in a ~ were supported as
repository destinations, this adds support to specify
a home directory.

Change-Id: I0fec1bb938b2c91d22027f47b677f003a96f5715

commit_message:
Add Brick Fibre Channel attach/detach support.

This patch adds the required code to do
Fibre Channel attach and detaches of volumes.
This code has been pulled over from Nova's
implementation of FC attach/detach.

Also adds a new driver config entry to enable
multipath support for iSCSI and FC attaches
during volume to image and image
to volume transfers.

DocImpact

blueprint cinder-refactor-attach

Change-Id: I436592f958a6c14cd2a0b5d7e53362dd1a7c1a48

Add option to execute stress test in random order

A new option "-r/--random" introduced to execute json files in a
random order.

Implements: blueprint stress-tests

commit_message:
Fix extensions os-remote-consoles to follow API v3 rules

* Add extensions.expected_errors decorator
* Correct the action naming style
* Catch exception ConsoleTypeInvalid explicit

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ie07751b2db72c43af23936e2e8c00ee3c861428a

commit_message:
Add a test for customizing AWS::EC2::Instance

InstanceGroup explicitly supports "custom" versions of AWS::EC2::Instance
(instead of directly using heat.engine.resources.instance.Instance)
but there was no unit test for that feature. Here we add one.

Change-Id: I490675c18734a61d27625ed3c76fb228e3fd1a9d

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-14 22:23:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

According to Doug's comment, it seems we need to ensure to use cmd2>=0.6.5, but the current requirement does not satisfy it. Could you clarify the situation?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-15 04:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I don't quite understand Doug's comment. U can see the version of cliff, which requires cmd2. cliff will decide the version of pyparsing."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-15 22:16:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this patch works, but the commit message is wrong.

cmd2 == 0.6.4 requires pyparsing >= 1.5.6 but does not handle the fact that pyparsing == 2.x.x is for python 3 only and does not work at all on python 2.

https://bitbucket.org/catherinedevlin/cmd2/src/c4c35f002aef31d9e49b5306c5a1995eb690ab85/setup.py?at=0.6.4

The commit message for this patch should be changed to remove the assertion that the change works because cmd2 0.6.4 brings in the right version of pyparsing.

commit_message:
let cliff install the right pyparsing

Bug #1197083

cliff(>=1.4) reqires:
PrettyTable>=0.6,<0.8
cmd2>=0.6.4
pyparsing==1.5.7

Change-Id: Ifac96211c3d728d68cde21a2d1dd3714a9dcc5de

messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-07-16 17:02:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I struggled quite a bit with the testing of this bug. The fix is obvious if you simply look at the code, however it is not obvious how one can unit test this. I struggled through mocking out all of the libvirt domain calls and sqlalchemy calls until I realized it wasn't going to add much value in the end. The actual situation I encountered this bug in can be reproduced at the functional level quite easily, but it's such a specific case that I'm not sure it deserves its own test. I'd appreciate some direction here if testing for this bug is deemed necessary."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 17:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
xenapi: enable attach volumes to non-running VM

Similar to when detaching a volume, ensure we only attempt to
plug a VBD when the server is running, otherwise it will fail.
This also fixes up the existing unit test that was not working.

Fixes bug 1199477
Change-Id: I32d85ca09849b63b815cc3daba3bb02c31d92e8d

commit_message:
Passing volume ID as id to InvalidBDMVolume exception

Passing volume ID as positional argument causes error
 when formatting exception message.

Fixes bug 1200584

Change-Id: Iac49c8b5c13d3807e8bb744151300418b121bd5c

Makes _PATH_CELL_SEP a public global variable

_PATH_CELL_SEP is used outside of cells.utils so it should be not be private

commit_message:
modernize quantum config in proper place

Bug #1200558

At the beginning, we have not registered some configuration
items. To modernize these items, we must do it after we register
them.

Change-Id: I90d2cdbe97daa2ec0a8c8b6c9686b6f76c4de9e4

commit_message:
Improve packet-filter test coverage in NEC Plugin

blueprint nec-plugin-test-coverage

This commit adds unit tests for packet-filter in NEC Plugin.

This commit refactors packet-filter in NEC Plugin.
- Put packet-filter classes and methods into nec/packet_filter.py (a) and
  nec/db/packetfilter.py (b), NEC Plugin specific codes are in (a)
- Change stateless methods to class methods in extenstions/packetfilter.py
- Add 'convert_to' option to the attribute map of packet-filter to convert
  some string parameter to int at the api layer

Also, this commit includes the following changes in packet-filter.
- Fix attribute map of packet-filter; set in_port to allow_put=False
- Add new methods to update attribute map properly
- Make packet-filters ignore status of associated resource (network)

Change-Id: I7c0b76afb603f1f078b28610181b16ce66225d37

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-06-12 21:46:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So, this keeps a list of the client tokens in the API node itself, correct?  What happens if you're running two API nodes behind a load balancer?"}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-12 21:51:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Right, it's in the API node. Two load-balanced nodes would be a problem, as would restarting the API node.  Is it better to try and push this into the db (the client token is EC2 API specific, I don't think there's an OSAPI analog, is there?)"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-06-12 22:59:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah, I think we need some sort of federated storage of ClientToken for this, so a database table makes the most sense.  And no, there is no OSAPI analog that I'm aware of…"}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-13 21:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

It occurs to me we could use the instance metadata for this without adding another table. The added benefit is that it would show up in the EC2 tags API, so users could list the client tokens, update them, etc.  Any thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-14 05:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 06:19:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Support Client Token for EC2 RunInstances

The EC2 API allows users to provide a unique ClientToken in a RunInstances
call. Future invocations of RunInstances with the same ClientToken return
the same response but do not create new instances.

Fixes bug 1188327.

Change-Id: I88d40db3c04355a752474217cdb184cd386d060c

commit_message:
Allow ::/0 for IPv6 security group rules

Nova fails to create a security group rule if ::/0 is used as
value for the cidr field

Fixes: LP bug #1199943

Change-Id: Ifce53dbc9f0740337921491aa752900892f47052
Signed-off-by: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>

'}, {'created': '2013-07-02 09:31:33.000000000', 'message': 'Patch sqlalchemy-migrate to fix UC bugs in SQLite

Nova and other projects use sqlalchemy-migrate for DB schema
migrations. Unfortunately, this project looks like to be dead,
but have some important bugs which makes lives of OpenStack
developers harder (e. g. creation of a new unique constraint
in SQLite leads to deletion of all existing unique constraints).

We already have some workarounds for bugs and limitations of
sqlalchemy-migrate, though it would be nice to have those directly
in sqlalchemy-migrate (at least in form of a monkey-patch for now).

Later, this can be put to Oslo and reused by other projects, which
relies on sqlalchemy-migrate for applying of DB schema migrations.

This patch:
  - makes it possible to use the unified drop_unique_constraint()
    function for SQLite backend
  - fixes a bug in sqlalchemy-migrate that leads to deletion of
    existing unique constraints of a table when a new one is added
    (SQLite backend)

Change-Id: I5c95187430e4e49489b4e2b66f95a05f23948f84

commit_message:
Patch sqlalchemy-migrate to fix UC bugs in SQLite

Nova and other projects use sqlalchemy-migrate for DB schema
migrations. Unfortunately, this project looks like to be dead,
but have some important bugs which makes lives of OpenStack
developers harder (e. g. creation of a new unique constraint
in SQLite leads to deletion of all existing unique constraints).

We already have some workarounds for bugs and limitations of
sqlalchemy-migrate, though it would be nice to have those directly
in sqlalchemy-migrate (at least in form of a monkey-patch for now).

This patch uses Oslo code that:
  - makes it possible to use the unified drop_unique_constraint()
    function for SQLite backend
  - fixes a bug in sqlalchemy-migrate that leads to deletion of
    existing unique constraints of a table when a new one is added
    (SQLite backend)

Fixes bug 1200265.

Change-Id: I5c95187430e4e49489b4e2b66f95a05f23948f84

commit_message:
Configure rabbit and EPMD to bind to an address

This change integrates against a rabbitmq cookbook feature which
is not yet merged upstream.  However, given the default code path
does not change, felt okay to get this out there.  Especially b/c
we are dependant on it.  This feature allows one to run rabbit
and clustering across a specific address.  For more details, see:
  http://tickets.opscode.com/browse/COOK-3320

Change-Id: I2a10c551cb2176dadaee8842eeadfdfc8cb93e44

commit_message:
Enable zero the snapshot when delete snapshot in LVMVolumeDriver

Because snapshot without 'size' field, So clear_volume method in
LVMVolumeDriver will skip secure deleting. Get the size of snapshot from
'volume_size' filed, So it can zero the snapshot.

Remove the 'size_in_g' parameter in _delete_volume method, because it never
used. Add a unittest for clear_volume method.

Fixes  Bug #1198185

Change-Id: Ie919b50ce4fb276f29ab2e0279f868a691ea7bef

commit_message:
Remove useless mongodb connection pool comment

As connection pool feature has been delivered in 'Use a real MongoDB instance
to run unit tests', remove the relevant comments in code.

Change-Id: I515c7818350d39173f4435c4141b4e929c1a1a6c

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-07-15 06:28:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I strongly recommend to do not merge this change in this moment. Because it is very dangerous and it contains bugs.

Bugs are next:
1) At least migrations 160, 161 was add to stable branch (after realize)
So probably our customer are on 159 migration, so they won't be able to run db sync after this change. 

Reasons why I am against:
1) You removed all tests that checks at least that migrations works properly. 
2) Our models and migrations are not synced and there are no tests that checks it. 
3) Tests are run only against sqlite, that doesn't check indexes, fk, and unique constraints names. 
4) Probably you have lost some indexes, or add wrong names to unique constraints.

So until we finish our work around syncing models / fixing bugs in migrations / adding tests against other backends it shouldn't be merged."}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-07-15 06:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

one minor nit'}, {'account_id': 6507, 'date': '2013-07-15 06:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Boris. More over we had done a hard work: syncing models and migrations, that shows us that actual state of db has a lot of bugs.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/db-sync-models-with-migrations
It is a very important to have huge tests cover that will checks every migration and actual state of db. We have only mysql checking https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34212/ today that found these bugs."}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-07-15 07:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

thanks boris and Svetlana, so I may do this later and resubmit.'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-07-17 08:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Compact pre-Havana database migrations.

Compacts the pre-Havana database migrations into a single
migration (161_grizzly.py), also removes related db migrate
tests in test_migrations.py.

Pre-Havana users will need to upgrade to Grizzly before
running any Havana migrations.

This is a long term BP, and has been done by Dan Prince in
Folsom and Grizzly.

Implements blueprint db-migration-cleanup

Change-Id: I9f8212fb1862fe8e29cbd3ea1dbf8da2a84ead8f

commit_message:
Remove unused recreate-db options from run_test.sh

run_tests.sh had an option to delete tests.sqlite, but that file is not
used anymore so the run_test options don't do anything.

Change-Id: I1abb257579da34c9dd7698543d8297268276bbc5

commit_message:
Sort output for unit tests in test_describe_tags before compare

There's no guarantees on what order the output from describe_tags
comes back in, so it needs to be sorted.

Partially fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: Ibb2619e8077ea8b8bd4796f9ffe89c2376d047f6

commit_message:
Redstack always overwrites the localrc file

Devstack can be customized by creating a localrc file before the
installation but redstack overwrites it without checking if the
file already exists.

Fixes Bug1194793

Change-Id: I70673cfcbe6041be4c6ebea9e2d68e33c7159ad2

"}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-07-01 23:12:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(8 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-02 02:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-02 02:46:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (8 inline comments)

If there is a REMOTE_USER present in a v3 auth call then the auth token or other methods in the auth body won't be checked at all so there is no token binding happening here. This is existing behaviour and fixing it will depend on the pluggable-remote-user blueprint."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-02 03:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-keystone-pep8/5997 : SUCCESS in 1m 29s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-keystone-docs/4370/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 27s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-keystone-python26/4890 : SUCCESS in 12m 22s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-keystone-python27/4903 : SUCCESS in 7m 19s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/27701 : SUCCESS in 42m 30s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/27407 : SUCCESS in 43m 09s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/35537 : SUCCESS in 17m 16s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35093/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/14127 : FAILURE in 22m 11s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-07-03 06:47:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This stuff need to be in a separate token provider, after the token provider code is merged. There's no reason to sprinkle the logic all over the place. Just implement a bind_token provider and isolate the functionality there.

Similarly, you should have a bind_remote_user auth plugin, after ayoung remote_user auth plugin has merged.

I want to -2 this one. But want to hear your arguments first in case I miss something."}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-03 08:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So i realize this will have to go into one of the token providers. I'm not sure yet how that will merge but it's not that big a change. However it's not a new token format and it doesn't require a provider of it's own. It's an optional parameter that might exist on a token and so can be worked into the existing code. 

Whether this happens before or after the token pluggability i don't mind (I was hoping before as that way it would just get swept up in your refactoring).

Regarding auth plugins i'm not sure where ayoung is on that but you're right, particularly authenticating against v3 it's not quite right. However mostly this can be said about the REMOTE_USER stuff in v3 anyway. 

I don't think that I should push bind checking into middleware as that would require me to pull the token from the database which should be optionally shared into the app to prevent it looking it up again. 

Anyway, i agree auth could use a clean up but between your tokens, ayoung's identity split and remote_user plugins the last thing i want to do is more auth refactoring."}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-04 04:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-04 05:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Implement Token Binding.

Brings token binding to keystone server. There are a number of places
where the location or hardcoding of binding checks are not optimal
however fixing them will require having a proper authentication plugin
scheme so just assume that they will be moved when that happens.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint authentication-tied-to-token

commit_message:
Implemented token creation without catalog response.

Modified the token_factory to create token responses with
or without the catalog entry.

blueprint catalog-optional

Change-Id: Icdc4400f08f4619a19e44129c78240800a3a1e75

[{'created': '2013-07-12 01:35:33.000000000', 'message': 'Minor reorg for (array resource usage and backend options naming)

1. Use HUS target/initiator resources efficiently.
2. Command options aligned with openStack scheme of using dashes.
3. Self tests modified to accomodate #1 and #2.

Change-Id: I7d23a980f237c973538ca08215f77a1f69cc2517
Fixes: bug 1200441
'}]
commit_message:
Minor reorg for (array resource usage and backend options naming)

1. Use HUS target/initiator resources efficiently.
2. Command options aligned with openStack scheme of using dashes.
3. Self tests modified to accomodate #1 and #2.

Change-Id: I7d23a980f237c973538ca08215f77a1f69cc2517
Fixes: bug 1200441

- http://logs.openstack.org/36351/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/16141 : FAILURE in 27m 10s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-10 00:55:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I am very excited by this. Some feedback:

- Could this go at the top of the Stack Detail -> Overview tab? This would mean moving all code into project/stacks/
- Could stack launch redirect to Stack Detail so they can watch the action? (maybe on deleting a single stack too?)

And for some bikeshedding:
- Could the resource name be attached to a node as a label, just to provide some differentiation between nodes?
- I thought it would be nice if the icons were designed in the theme of OpenStack's homepage branding http://www.openstack.org/themes/openstack/images/homepage/openstack-mini-homepage-diagram.png"}, {'account_id': 7714, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Steve, 

Just to address your inline comments, I agree with all of them. :) I was planning on doing some additional work to that section of code to also make sure that my regex is addressing as many resource types as possible.

I was planning on moving it to the Stack Detail tabs but I was going to give it a tab of its own. I can put it inside of the Overview tab but it feels a little busy in my opinion, especially if we add more UI elements in the future to allow more interaction, like Updates and Deletes. 

If I do give it its own tab I would also suggest some re-naming: I would change "Stack Details" to "Stack Overview", then have the "Overview" tab become "Metadata" maybe? Then the tabs would be:
"Topology", "Metadata", "Resources", "Events"

This naming structure feels more like a Dashboard to me, but of course I'm open to feedback.

I looked into redirecting directly to the topology but I think I couldn't because the API stack_create doesn't return the stack_id that was just created. I'll double check this and add a Heat bp to fix this if we need to.

bikeshedding:

I originally had the resource name attached as a label but it became apparent that everything became a jumbled mess if you have more than 6 resources on the page, especially if the relationships pack them together. Now you still get the resource name if you hover but there is more work to do to fix this. I was thinking of writing an algorithm that detects common resources and shrinks their size based on how many there are, or possibly splitting common resources off of a "group" node. If we really want the resource names attached I could work on spacing out the nodes better.

Icons are always difficult :/ I'll see if i can figure something out but right now the hard part is the Openstack icons, the "Compute" icon and "Storage" icon are almost the same, the compute one is slightly more transparent on top but the main difference is the color. In the case of the topology we are using color to indicate the status of the node so we can't rely on it to be a visual cue for actual representation. I'll take some time and see if I can come up with something though.

Again, feedback is most welcome so feel free to ping me for more discussion!'}, {'account_id': 7714, 'date': '2013-07-10 15:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Revising Topology after feedback'}, {'account_id': 7714, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7714, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 22:05:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Replace get_instance_metadata call in api.ec2.cloud._format_instances

The _format_instances method in api.ec2.cloud populates an instance
dictionary from the sqlalchemy instance model objects, and populates the
metadata by calling compute.api.get_instance_metadata.

This is unnecessary, since the instance objects already have metadata
attached. The helper class is needed until the migration to nova objects
is complete.

Partially fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: Ib5a593bd36c8d6a531b9494b9861cca9a40ed08a

commit_message:
remove improper assert usage

There're many talks about it. An assert should be used for `never
happen` cases, not common paramaters validating.

With grep, we could many all assert statement used in none-test codes:

cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py:110:
cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py:116:
cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py:161:
cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py:162:
cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py:163:
cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py:164:
cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py:170:
    checking cmd output which should never changed, so leave it
cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py:113:
    ensure file existence from impossible cases, so leave it
cinder/utils.py:
    used for functional flow, so use ValueError instead

fixes bug #1199354
Change-Id: I2b1701269bdf7c8737548e57bd940921a6256372

"}, {'account_id': 2667, 'date': '2013-04-18 22:15:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Good stuff! Few comments:
1. Would be good to put the description in a blueprint, and to point to it from here.
2. It might be easier to break this into several patches and review/merge it in smaller pieces
3. I am not sure that this level of fine-grained modeling in Nova DB is necessary. Consider just reporting the capability (device type) and capacity (total vs free), and manage individual allocations within nova-compute. Should scheduler care which instance is using which of the (identical) devices on a particular host?"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-21 11:29:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Alex,

Thanks for review.
Sorry didn't have time to write normal description for this approach..

About points..

1. Yes you are right I should add info about this approach in BP and link it
from here. Will do it soon.

2. I agree that reviewing big patches is a hard task. If you take a
look at my other patches you will see that I am trying to separate work in a
lot of small patches. But here we have a bit different situation.
This is special refactored version of ISP RAS pci passthoruhg solution that
contains only minimal changes that are required for base PCI passthrough
providing. (There is no special API for this and there is no code in
nova-manager).

So in few words what is made in this patch:
1) Input information about available pci devieces through nova.conf

2) By hand add special instance type extra specs that contians list of labels
of devices that should be passthroughed.

3) New filter for scheduler that is used for filtering nodes by available
   and required labels.
4) In host_manager we have to add info about free labels. (This is required if
   we run more then one instance by one request)

5) Libvirt implementation for pci passthrouhg devices.

6) Compute.manager that connects avilable pci devices on host with required by
   instance_type.

I don't know what we could split here to make it easier for reviews and
global understanding.

If we split for example work with DB and other work in separated patch it will be
not so clear why we choose such Table for PciDevices and why we have such
methods...

So I am not sure that spliting this patch will help us.


3. Probably I haven't described clear enough how this level works,
so there is missundersting. I will try to describe it in other words here.

I think I should just show changes in life cycle of creating instance.

1. User new_instance -> Request to compute.api # nothing changed

2. compute.api -> scheduler # now in instance_type we have special extra_specs
for labels called pci_passthrough:labels

3. scheduler. The algorithm is next:
a) get all compute_nodes (Now in compute_nodes we have also pci_devices)

b) Transform data from compue_nodes to HostStates (here we have now free available pci_labels)

c) Now we have to create N instances, and each time we are making next to things:

d) filter hosts (and now we have new filter that will check that all labels from instance_type_extra_specs exsist in host_state)

e) rpc to compute.manager on best host

So there is no fine-grained work with db here.. 
So only what use scheduler are instance_type_extra_specs and available labels on host.
So I will try to optimize this by join only pci_devices.labels and join only pci_devices that are free.


4. compute.manager take care about what exactly pci devices will be attached
to instance in DB, but I made it through one query to avoid race conditions.
And I think that it is reasonable.


P.S. I don't know what pluses we will get if we will use reports to check free pci 
devices instead of my solution get each time with compute_nodes info about pci_devices? 


If each compute node will report about status it will produce 2 big problems:

1) Big load. If we have 10'000 compue_nodes and each report each 1 minut it will produce ~170 reports/sec
(for each report we should make db query)

2) Inconsistency, we have always old data... (So in big systems we will have much more rescheduling..)

If each scheduler will get data from DB then the solution is not better then my
because scheduler should be smarter then now. And also we will have always old data."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 19:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'PCI Passthrough Base

The goal of this patch is to add base support for pci passthrough in Nova.

This patch was based on ISP RAS solution and after rebase and refactor I am not
sure that there is no type/bugs, because I haven't enough time to run real
deployement and try to create instance with pci device..
(But ISP RAS patch is well tested and concept works)

How it works?
It could be split in separated parts:
    1)  Scheduler layer (filter)
    2)  DB layer (store)
    3)  CONF layer (input)
    4)  Compute layer (save pci and instance state in DB)
    5)  Virt layer (libvirt pci device passthrough)

1) Scheduler layer (filter):

This is probably the main part and most complex for implementation.

First of all what we have?
A lot of compute nodes where we have a lot of devices that could be used
for pci passthrouhg. We should be able to filter compute nodes by devices that
it has and that are in same time free (it is not used by any other VM).

To be able to slove it we should:
a) Store information about PCI devices on each host and availability status
b) On different hosts same devices could have different addresses so we should
   use some more abstract name. I've called it labels.
c) To store information about what pci devices are required for instance I used
   InstanceTypeExtraSpecs pcipasthrouhg:labels that contains list of labels in
   json
d) Compute node should have information about pci devices

If we have all this things then algorithm of filtering hosts is pretty simple:
    a) Get info about all hosts with all pci devices
    b) Get labels from instance type that are required
    c) filter all hosts that have required labels
    d) consume info from selected host (now labels are used)
    e) rpc to selected host run this instance

2) DB layer (store)
So we should create new table for pci devices that should have next columns:

a) label (This is abstract name of device for example infiniband)
b) adress (This is real pci address domain:slot:bus.function)
c) status
d) instance_uuid (instance that uses this device)
e) host
f) compute_id (compute_node_id on that has this device)

So there is only few method that we are actuilly use:
1) destroy all on host devices
2) attach to instance devices with labels from array
3) create device

About these methods I will tell later..

3)  CONF layer (input)
To specify devices that are able on host I used nova.conf.
Add new parameter pci_passthrouhg_devices that has json string that contains
list of objects {"address":string, "label":string}

But there is a big problem with storeing infromation about pci devices and
updating DB. It could be described by next situation:

    a) specify pci device in nova.conf
    b) run compute node and create specified pci device
    c) run instance with this device

And then you would like probably to modify this parameter...

So the algorithm is next:
On each periodic task sync_compute_node we are calling sync_pci_device.
sync_pci_device make next thing:
first time it makes:
    a) delete all old pci_devices from host that are not used
    b) for devices that are used we are changing status -> to_delete
    c) trying to create all new devices from confing. Store info about created.
other times:
    d) try to create devices that wasn't created. Store info about new created.

to_delete is special status of pci_devices that will be destroyed after
instance that used it.

So it will update all pci device after some time..

4) Compute layer (save pci and instance state in DB)
When scheduler choosed host we should update or pci_device entries in db.
(that are on specified host and in list of specified labels)
It is done with only one call of our db.api so there is no race condition.

5) Virt layer (libvirt pci device passthrough)
It is pretty simple, we have instance with pci_devices that has address, so we
should detach from host this device and do reset.

When we are creating libvirt domain we should add specific XML for pci
passthrouhg, node is called `hostdev`.

And there are some small hacks..
We are not able to suspend machine with pci devices.. So we should detach it
from nede and then on resume return it. Same problem with snapshoting.

Change-Id: I088f3438c1cb4496bcac64069c047f2c8c58450d

commit_message:
PCI passthrough Compute layer

compute.resource_tracker:
  Use utils to sync pci devices in DB and nova.conf

compute.manger:
  Bind to instance record in DB all required by label pci devices

blueprint pci-passthrough-base

Change-Id: I42ad50cc64c065a0700ca6ae0dd8368fd6f20b66

ie, what should user do if he prefers '/mnt/node'."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-06-08 07:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

This is just a reference document, people who care or prefer to use something else than /srv/node would probably would know how to do that without having to be mentionned in the installation documentation. And and there is much more than that with all the manpages that would need to be updated if we were going this way.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-08 07:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

But there's something confused about this '/srv/node'. In config file, it is called 'device', but 'device_dir' in some other documents. And should this config be set differently in different nodes?

And the 'sda' following '/srv/node' still need more explanation. If one node has /dev/hda, how do we set 'sda' in ring and what's the mount points? and any problems? for swift beginners, a swift view of configuring details is very helpful I think

BTW, commit message mentioned "Explain why we use "/srv/node"", but seems not

Just my own viewpoints, the others part of this patch is good'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-12 19:11:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-03-09 00:11:21.000000000', 'message': 'Improve "Multiple Server Swift Installation" documentation

- Reverse Proxy & Storage order (to keep same structure as admin doc)
- Explain why we use "/srv/node"

Fix bug #1147331

Change-Id: I335727fa157c5254c2173effb033fa003d35129d
'}, {'created': '2013-03-09 00:12:48.000000000', 'message': 'Improve "Multiple Server Swift Installation" documentation

- Reverse Proxy & Storage order (to keep same structure as admin doc)
- Explain why we use "/srv/node"

commit_message:
Improve "Multiple Server Swift Installation" documentation

- Reverse Proxy & Storage order (to keep same structure as admin doc)
- Explain why we use "/srv/node"

Fix bug #1147331

Change-Id: I335727fa157c5254c2173effb033fa003d35129d

commit_message:
Allow keystone url to be accessed via tenant_name

- We allow URL access via AUTH_tenantName but still store internally as
  UUID.
- This should not conflict with domain since tenantId should be
  differents even tho tenantName should be the same.
- Implements blueprint keystoneauth-tenant-name-url.

Change-Id: I8b86407808beea00625416333cb440fbfe91e035

commit_message:
Implementation of Volume Anti Affinity Filter.

This filter allows one to place a volume on a different host
to which specified volumes don't belong.

Blueprint cinder-volume-antiaffinity-filter

Change-Id: I1e4d13804537ee57427c64be02cda113214d41f3

commit_message:
Nova does not work due to neutron rename

Due to the new quantum/neutronclient package rename
the current nova code does not work correctly.

Fixes the bug: 1198040

Change-Id: If0644e947329439aa4700498e703d9f96855277d

commit_message:
Provided tenant-id support for keystone user-create.

Currently when a user is created through CLI using
keystone user-create, the user's tenant cannot be
updated through CLI. Provided tenant-id support for
keystone user-create cli command. Now using CLI
option we can update tenant for a user.
Fixed code review comments and modify help text.

Fixes: bug #1177224
Change-Id: I777c6ab7e7dc3577ac83f165c5a0dd62641f09fd

commit_message:
Add tests for cinder/api/urlmap.py

Add tests for unquoting and parsing functions in
TestParseFunction class
Add tests for Accept class methods:
 - TestAccept class - test cases for processing content types
 - TestUrlMapFactory - test cases for urlmap factory
Add tests for URLMap class methods except __call__ method in TestURLMap

Change-Id: I3f1aa527f49175d9fac6fbe7309383709c30c237

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-16 16:28:50.000000000', 'message': 'Check missing parameters during stack create

Add missing parameters checking logic to Parameter validation. It
has to be optional, since template validation makes use of the same
Parameter validation code.

Fixes bug #1198670

Change-Id: I4c85ebf496b19999e47cf3838e6ca160aa194f20
'}]
commit_message:
Check missing parameters during stack create

Add missing parameters checking logic to Parameter validation. It
has to be optional, since template validation makes use of the same
Parameter validation code.

Fixes bug #1198670

Change-Id: I4c85ebf496b19999e47cf3838e6ca160aa194f20

commit_message:
Fix error when QuotaUsage.updated_at is NULL

When QuotaUsage.updated_at is None, it will raise non-expected exception.
Just verify it.

Fix bug 1197259

Change-Id: I2b41d025f8cffa6c0b3f0153a5194d5e7b1a05df

commit_message:
Fix argument name mismatch in L3-RPC sync_routers

In sync_routers L3-RPC method l3-agent sends router_ids but the
server side expected router_id. This commit fixes the server side
to accept router_ids, and drops "fullsync" arg from the agent side
(fullsync is not used anywhere and it does not affect RPC signature).
This change allows l3-agent to sync only the specified routers
instead of all routers.

Fixes bug #1201553

As a result of the above change, auto_schedule_routers() and
list_active_sync_routers_on_active_l3_agent() in L3 scheduler
needs to handle a list of router IDs. This commit changes L3 scheduler
to accept a list of router IDs in the above two methods.

Also fixes the argument order of fullsync and router_ids in get_routers
in L3PluginApi. L3-agent main code expects router_ids as the second arg.

Change-Id: I22e8d11b9676cbcfe9e72449031bb63071be8314

commit_message:
Add os-services extension support

Implement client bindings for Cinder os-services API extension, so
client would be able to list services, enable or disable particular
services.

Usage:
cinder service-list [--host <hostname>] [--binary <binary>]
cinder service-enable <hostname> <binary>
cinder service-disable <hostname> <binary>

This change is depended on following change at Cinder side
I7f3fa889294ca6caebdf46b8689345bcac1cdf54

Implements blueprint os-services-extension

Change-Id: I4a53fd545ed3b446441302d00a429168a996a34a

commit_message:
Fix XML rendering with empty auth payload.

Just add some sensible defaults to places where XML parses for example
an empty dictionary as an empty string. Also 'access' shouldn't be
considered a plural.

Change-Id: I9fb2c4f5c32ed8c2ce8ba4038caaae39590f8c1a

we could then use a config and provider scheme like this to add new auth types, but that config option will want to at least be a list not a string"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-13 04:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Trying to get the patches that need to merge and that will conflict into sequence.

This patch  is just for letting people swap out the implementation, which is something that was requested at the last summit.  You can expand what is done here, this is just providing the requested mechanism.'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-13 04:45:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Right but i think the general concept of handling external authentication will be standard and what we need is to allow a plugin system of different external handlers. This would be making the core part pluggable.

How would something like this handle the situation where you can use one of multiple external authentication mechanisms? There isn't much in that vein that is practical right now but how do you say you can use kerberos or basic auth?"}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-13 04:48:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

does this need to be done in this order? can it be post freeze? '}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-16 01:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-16 01:59:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@guang-yee i don't think we should have an 'external' mechanism. If you are doing something externally it should really be external (ie no impact on the body). 

It's definetly not perfect but an extension point is a good idea and we can use it to have a clear path later. 

As a quick example though not all external auth's provide REMOTE_USER, x509 definitely doesn't and we shouldn't need to check for all the headers before calling the plugin. I agree with the entry point but we will have to look later at how it is used."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 02:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-07-16 05:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

ayoung, jamielennox, I think you guys misunderstood my proposal. Client doesn't have to change anything. What auth controller ended up with is REMOTE_USER in the context and whatever that is populated by Apache front-end (peer certificate, kerberos principal, whatever). What I am proposing is a "mechanism" to ensure consistency. We don't want to end up with a dichotomy of plugin framework. The proposed data structure is really internal, used by auth controller to communicate with the "remote_user" auth plugin only.

{"auth": {
  "identity": {
    "methods": ["external"]
  }
}

It is really a trick, if you will, to make sure all plugins are "managed" by the framework. Since the request context is passed into the plugin, remote_user plugin should have everything it needs to populate the auth_context.

btw, as a side node, I think this code, in its current form, might be breaking backward compatibility. Looking at the code, I am not sure if it supports domain-scoped or project-scoped (other than default project) tokens.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-16 16:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 17:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-07-12 14:25:08.000000000', 'message': 'Pluggable Remote User

Select the code to handle REMOTE_USER based on a config file option

blueprint pluggable-remote-user

Change-Id: I9dda6dbe073f03806bdf539db6faa01644109f1c
'}, {'created': '2013-07-15 17:43:43.000000000', 'message': 'Pluggable Remote User

Select the code to handle REMOTE_USER based on a config file option

Fixes the REMOTE_USER logic to get the domain name from
REALM, which is the least surprise option.

Disregards the auth_data passed in, as we should be using REMOTE_USER
to get the user name.

commit_message:
Pluggable Remote User

Select the code to handle REMOTE_USER based on a config file option

Fixes the REMOTE_USER logic to get the domain name from
REALM, which is the least surprise option.

Disregards the auth_data passed in, as we should be using REMOTE_USER
to get the user name.

External Plugin is now executed in conjunction with the auth methods,
as opposed to in place of them.

DocImpact

blueprint pluggable-remote-user

Change-Id: I9dda6dbe073f03806bdf539db6faa01644109f1c

commit_message:
Adding Cinder backend storage driver to Glance

This change allows Glance drive Cinder as a block storage backend to
store image data.
Before this we already use swift as an object storage backend to save
image.

Currently the patch is a partial implementation, after Cinder expose
'brick' library, 'host-volume-attaching' and 'multiple-attaching'
enhancement ready, the store will support ADD/GET/DELETE interface
finally.

blueprint: glance-cinder-driver

Change-Id: I4cdeccdb518972c0280e59c984ed6b001dafe243
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Mark methods used in class only with prefix "_"

In the swift driver the three methods prepare_nbackup, backup_chunk
and finalize_backup are used internally in the class only and are
not meant to be used from outside. Thus marked with prefix "_"

Change-Id: Idf3a75f2e799c16b1442a349e0724d3e5af2795a

commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names.

Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and tools/test-requires
to test-requirements.txt. These are standard files, and tools in the
general world are growing intelligence about them.

Change-Id: Ifcfc82060116127f5acb5215b140eef31f7882a4
Fixes: bug #1179008

I've tried it, and as I mention in the in line comment, it can't work as is, with a vxlan only config. nevertheless, i'm ok with it since this bug will be addressed in https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1196963"}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-15 14:38:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

Mathieu, 'tunnel_type' should be passed by the agent during tunnel_sync() since this patch [1] was merged over the weekend which does just that.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33107/"}, {'account_id': 2888, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:30:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

Kyle i don't agree with you, when the agent call tunnel_sync, it doesn't ask the plugin for a specific tunnel_type. But when it parse the response, it looks for the tunnel_type in the rpc response, which is not provided by the ml2 plugin nor by the OVS plugin. Since the agent return when no tunnel_type is found in the RPC answer of tunnel_sync, the implementation in [1] breaks tunneling even for OVS.

I fill a bug for this [2]

I think the good patch is to ask for a specific tunnel_type when calling tunnel_sync

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33107/21
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1201471"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-16 00:40:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

See the in-line comments. 

It looks like the tunnel_id_range parsing has the same issue as in the GreTypeDriver patch.

This biggest issue is that the tunnel_sync RPC parameters are not consistent. I think the most sensible solution is to have the agent always pass tunnel_type to the server in tunnel_sync, and for the agent not to expect tunnel_type to be set in the list of endpoints returned by the server (they are assumed to all be the requested type). The agent will always know what tunnel_type is being synced, so no default is needed. This needs to be make consistent across the openvswitch agent, openvswitch plugin, ml2 GreTypeDriver, and ml2 VxLanTypeDriver."}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-16 13:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-16 13:49:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Works for me

commit_message:
Add VXLAN tunneling support for the ML2 plugin

Add an ML2 Type Driver for VXLAN networks to allow the creation
of VXLAN networks with the OVS agent.

Change-Id: I7fcc384cc44d5adc752510847d8ba5f46bbb79fb
Implements: blueprint ml2-vxlan

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 00:29:19.000000000', 'message': "Increate timeout period for clone volume.

Current timeout value for clone volume in the
SolidFire driver is 20 seconds, this is fine
in many cases however there seems to be a
number of customers doing clones of
volumes >= 400G.

A populated 400G volume is taking upwards of
35 seconds to clone in some cases resulting in failure.

There's no reason not to bump this timeout value up
significantly to a worst case scenario (ie multi-terrabyte volume).

Fixes bug: 1202007

Change-Id: I98c399f5d647e14f031018f7fc1cc43bb0d94c84
"}, {'created': '2013-07-17 00:30:20.000000000', 'message': "Increase timeout period for clone volume.

SolidFire driver is 20 seconds, this is fine
in many cases however there seems to be a

volumes >= 400G.

A populated 400G volume is taking upwards of

Fixes bug: 1202007

Change-Id: I98c399f5d647e14f031018f7fc1cc43bb0d94c84
"}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout period for clone volume.

Current timeout value for clone volume in the
SolidFire driver is 20 seconds, this is fine
in many cases however there seems to be a
number of customers doing clones of
volumes >= 400G.

A populated 400G volume is taking upwards of
35 seconds to clone in some cases resulting in failure.

There's no reason not to bump this timeout value up
significantly to a worst case scenario (ie multi-terrabyte volume).

Fixes bug: 1202007

Change-Id: I98c399f5d647e14f031018f7fc1cc43bb0d94c84

[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add gre tunneling support for the ML2 plugin

This patch add the type_driver GRE to enable the creation of GRE
tunnels with the OVS agent.
No Endpoints ID are managed. Only Endpoint IP are stored in DB,
and this IP is proposed as an endpoint ID for the OVS agent.

Implements: blueprint ml2-gre
Change-Id: I1a33a4bd3ebc4c97eecf17a59ce16b8c2066ec66

commit_message:
Add gre tunneling support for the ML2 plugin

This patch add the type_driver GRE to enable the creation of GRE
tunnels with the OVS agent.
No Endpoints ID are managed. Only Endpoint IP are stored in DB,
and this IP is proposed as an endpoint ID for the OVS agent.
It also fixes the bug 1201471.

Implements: blueprint ml2-gre
Change-Id: I1a33a4bd3ebc4c97eecf17a59ce16b8c2066ec66

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-07 08:30:13.000000000', 'message': "Implement role assignments inheritance (OS-INHERIT extension)

The inherited_to_projects flag is encoded in the role list in
the metadata of the relevant entries in the grant tables. The
'roles' key in the metadata is now a list of dicts, where each
dict is either

{'id': role_id} for a regular role, or
{'id': role_id, 'inherited_to': 'projects'} for an inherited role

Each of the grant api calls is extended to take the
inherited_to_projects flag, althoulh only valid for domain grants.
The response to the list_role_assignments call is also modified to
take account of inherited role assignments.

The extension can be enabled/disabled via a config setting.

Work still to do:

- Modify the 'get_roles_for_user_and_project()' call to interpret
  inherited roles and exapnd the role list accordingly
- extend the list_role_assignment response
- Make the extension discoverable via url
- Add all the testing for inherited roles

Implements bp/inherited-domain-roles

Change-Id: I35b57ce0df668f12462e96b3467cef0239594e97
"}, {'created': '2013-07-07 08:35:11.000000000', 'message': "Implement role assignment inheritance (OS-INHERIT extension)

"}, {'created': '2013-07-12 14:56:51.000000000', 'message': "Implement role assignment inheritance (OS-INHERIT extension)

This extension allows for project roles to be optionally
inherited from the owning domain.  The v3 grant APIs are extended
to take an inherited_to_projects flag.  The GET role_assignments
API will also include these roles in its response, either showing them
as inherited roles assigned to the domain or, if the 'effective'
query parameter is set, will interpret the inheritance and reflect
those role assignments on the projects.

The inherited_to_projects flag is encoded in the role list in
the metadata of the relevant entries in the grant tables. The
'roles' key in the metadata is now a list of dicts, as opposed
to a simple list, where each dict is either

{'id': role_id} for a regular role, or
{'id': role_id, 'inherited_to': 'projects'} for an inherited role

The extension can be enabled/disabled via a config setting.

WIP - Essentailly complet, with the following work still to do:

- Make the extension discoverable via url
- Make the extnesion disabled by default
- Fix an issue with sql migration where sqlalchemy appears to
  try and re-load a lond-deleted table (marked with FIXME)

A separate issue has been discovered with the fact that the v2
calls of 'get_projects_for_user()' and 'list_user_projects()'
should be rationalized and also honor both group (and inherited)
roles assignments.  This is being raised as a separate bug.

Implements bp inherited-domain-roles

Change-Id: I35b57ce0df668f12462e96b3467cef0239594e97

"}, {'created': '2013-07-12 23:52:24.000000000', 'message': "Implement role assignment inheritance (OS-INHERIT extension)

This extension allows for project roles to be optionally
inherited from the owning domain.  The v3 grant APIs are extended
to take an inherited_to_projects flag.  The GET role_assignments
API will also include these roles in its response, either showing them
as inherited roles assigned to the domain or, if the 'effective'
query parameter is set, will interpret the inheritance and reflect
those role assignments on the projects.

The inherited_to_projects flag is encoded in the role list in
the metadata of the relevant entries in the grant tables. The
'roles' key in the metadata is now a list of dicts, as opposed
to a simple list, where each dict is either

{'id': role_id} for a regular role, or
{'id': role_id, 'inherited_to': 'projects'} for an inherited role

The extension can be enabled/disabled via a config setting.

Limitations:

- The extension is not yet discoverable via url, this will be added
  as a separate patch when the v3/extensions work is complete.
- SQL migration for sqlite is not supported, since sqlite migrations
  were broken back at 015 and it is not considered worthwile
  maintaining this.

A separate issue has been discovered with the fact that the v2
calls of 'get_projects_for_user()' and 'list_user_projects()'
should be rationalized and also honor both group (and inherited)
roles assignments.  This is being raised as a separate bug.

Implements bp inherited-domain-roles

Change-Id: I35b57ce0df668f12462e96b3467cef0239594e97

"}, {'created': '2013-07-13 15:23:32.000000000', 'message': "Implement role assignment inheritance (OS-INHERIT extension)

This extension allows for project roles to be optionally
inherited from the owning domain.  The v3 grant APIs are extended
to take an inherited_to_projects flag.  The GET role_assignments
API will also include these roles in its response, either showing them
as inherited roles assigned to the domain or, if the 'effective'
query parameter is set, will interpret the inheritance and reflect
those role assignments on the projects.

The inherited_to_projects flag is encoded in the role list in
the metadata of the relevant entries in the grant tables. The
'roles' key in the metadata is now a list of dicts, as opposed
to a simple list, where each dict is either

{'id': role_id} for a regular role, or
{'id': role_id, 'inherited_to': 'projects'} for an inherited role

Remember that a previous patch had rationalized the way metadata is
handled so that its structure is entirely hidden within the driver
layer.

The extension can be enabled/disabled via a config setting.

Limitations:

- The extension is not yet discoverable via url, this will be added
  as a separate patch when the v3/extensions work is complete.
- SQL migration for sqlite is not supported, since sqlite migrations
  were broken back at 015 and it is not considered worthwile
  maintaining this.  test_sql_upgrade.py has been tested with MySQL
  to confirm correct functionality.

A separate issue has been discovered with the fact that the v2
calls of 'get_projects_for_user()' and 'list_user_projects()'
should be rationalized and also honor both group (and inherited)
role assignments.  This is being raised as a separate bug.

Implements bp inherited-domain-roles

Change-Id: I35b57ce0df668f12462e96b3467cef0239594e97
"}, {'created': '2013-07-13 22:37:29.000000000', 'message': "Implement role assignment inheritance (OS-INHERIT extension)

This extension allows for project roles to be optionally
inherited from the owning domain.  The v3 grant APIs are extended
to take an inherited_to_projects flag.  The GET role_assignments
API will also include these roles in its response, either showing them
as inherited roles assigned to the domain or, if the 'effective'
query parameter is set, will interpret the inheritance and reflect
those role assignments on the projects.

The inherited_to_projects flag is encoded in the role list in
the metadata of the relevant entries in the grant tables. The
'roles' key in the metadata is now a list of dicts, as opposed
to a simple list, where each dict is either

{'id': role_id} for a regular role, or
{'id': role_id, 'inherited_to': 'projects'} for an inherited role

Remember that a previous patch had rationalized the way metadata is
handled so that its structure is entirely hidden within the driver
layer.

The extension can be enabled/disabled via a config setting.

Limitations:

- The extension is not yet discoverable via url, this will be added
  as a separate patch when the v3/extensions work is complete.
- SQL migration for sqlite is not supported, since sqlite migrations
  were broken back at 015 and it is not considered worthwile
  maintaining this.  test_sql_upgrade.py has been tested with MySQL
  to confirm correct functionality.

A separate issue has been discovered with the fact that the v2
calls of 'get_projects_for_user()' and 'list_user_projects()'
should be rationalized and also honor both group (and inherited)
role assignments.  This is being raised as a separate bug.

Implements bp inherited-domain-roles

commit_message:
Implement role assignment inheritance (OS-INHERIT extension)

This extension allows for project roles to be optionally
inherited from the owning domain.  The v3 grant APIs are extended
to take an inherited_to_projects flag.  The GET role_assignments
API will also include these roles in its response, either showing them
as inherited roles assigned to the domain or, if the 'effective'
query parameter is set, will interpret the inheritance and reflect
those role assignments on the projects.

The inherited_to_projects flag is encoded in the role list in
the metadata of the relevant entries in the grant tables. The
'roles' key in the metadata is now a list of dicts, as opposed
to a simple list, where each dict is either

{'id': role_id} for a regular role, or
{'id': role_id, 'inherited_to': 'projects'} for an inherited role

Remember that a previous patch had rationalized the way metadata is
handled so that its structure is entirely hidden within the driver
layer.

The extension can be enabled/disabled via a config setting.

Limitations:

- The extension is not yet discoverable via url, this will be added
  as a separate patch when the v3/extensions work is complete.

A separate issue has been discovered with the fact that the v2
calls of 'get_projects_for_user()' and 'list_user_projects()'
should be rationalized and also honor both group (and inherited)
role assignments.  This is being raised as a separate bug.

DocImpact

Implements bp inherited-domain-roles

Change-Id: I35b57ce0df668f12462e96b3467cef0239594e97

subject: API for shelving

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7629, 'name': 'Shawn Hartsock', 'email': 'hartsock@acm.org', 'username': 'hartsocks'}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-21 19:50:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/29868 : SUCCESS in 4m 04s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-nova-docs/24087/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 17s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-nova-python26/25471 : FAILURE in 40m 13s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-nova-python27/25576 : FAILURE in 23m 56s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/25487 : FAILURE in 7m 24s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/25193 : FAILURE in 6m 38s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/33033 : FAILURE in 7m 11s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34033/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/12173 : FAILURE in 13m 40s (non-voting)

"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-22 00:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

why not make this notion part of heat?'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-24 13:55:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe,

That's a good question.  The reason this concept needs to live in Nova is that the biggest benefit of it is that a user can shelve an instance and retain all data associated with that model when they start it back up.  Now, most of that data can be rebuilt and re-associated with the instance from outside of Nova, but there are a few things that can't be.  The big one being the instance uuid.

Overall, while this feature is mainly a matter of orchestrating a few concepts that already exist in Nova, in order to control that orchestration from outside we would have to expose some internals that are better left internal."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-24 19:27:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Andrew,

Has there been a ML discussion about where this should live?  If not I think this warrants one, or at the very least get some reviews from the heat people here.

As for the UUID, its not clear to me why we would need that to remain the same.

Also I am not to keen on the periodic task to clean up the instance.  That seems like an operation a user would want to control, not the cloud operator."}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-06-24 19:34:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I suggest having the ability to save or not save the network configs related to a shelved instance."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-24 20:09:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe,

There has not been a ML discussion, but there was a summit discussion which was captured at https://etherpad.openstack.org/HavanaMothballServer.  I'd rather not have the debate again, but I do welcome some reviews from the Heat devs.  

The desire for the uuid to remain the same is so that users can continue to make API calls against the same uuid after an unshelving.  This is targeting use cases like a developer who shelves their instance in the evening and unshelves it at the start of a day, or after a weekend.  And while I realize that similar functionality can be accomplished from outside of Nova, this feature adds a lot of convenience for users by staying within Nova and not losing the instance model when shelved."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-24 20:28:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also, the periodic cleanup task is under discussion a bit in another review, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34032/1.  While there may be a better way to handle the cleanup, I'm not sure we want it under user control.  From a service provider standpoint shelving is nice because it offers users the ability to keep an instance at a reduced price because the hypervisor resources can be reclaimed at any point.  Leaving it under user control turns it into basically a stop/start operation."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-24 21:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have gone ahead and included some heat-cores on this review, to see if what they think.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-24 21:19:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

After talking to the heat team on IRC, I think this warrants a ML discussion. The only unusual thing in here is you are making use of "exts.extension_authorizer" more than the other extensions this is a good thing. You've got pretty solid use of the return codes and there could be an argument that "shelve" and "unshelve" are verbs and so it should really be that you say .../instance/ffff-ffff-ffff/shelve and .../instance/ffff-ffff-ffff/unshelve putting the verb after the noun (depending on how much you buy into the RMM, HATEOAS, and all that) but that would *completely* break the patterns in the rest of the API and I think consistency is very important.

So, I don't see anything wrong with doing things this way... but I'm just joe-random reviewer.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-28 21:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-21 19:09:14.000000000', 'message': "API for shelving

Adds new 'shelve' and 'unshelve' actions to the API.

The basic idea is that an instance can be put into a shelved state which
snapshots it, unless volume backed, and powers it down.  A periodic task
on the compute nodes will clean up the instance after a configurable
period of time(default: 3 days).  This should allow for fast startup
times when an instance is shelved for a night or over a weekend, and
free up resources when left longer.

bp shelve-instance

Change-Id: Idd485b591730c6ac025ee57a1242afdd02191b2f
"}, {'created': '2013-06-28 19:08:17.000000000', 'message': "API for shelving

functionality already provided in the compute api.

commit_message:
API for shelving

Adds new 'shelve', 'shelveOffload'/'shelve_offload'(V3), and 'unshelve'
actions to the API.  Exposes the functionality already provided in the
compute api.

Part of bp shelve-instance

Co-author: Dan Smith <danms@us.ibm.com> (Instance objects)
Change-Id: Idd485b591730c6ac025ee57a1242afdd02191b2f

commit_message:
Fix aggregate update.

Bug description: when update 'availability_zone'
value existing aggregate metadata cleared.

Method aggregate_update() in sqlalchemy api updated.

Fix bug 1200369.

Change-Id: Ie1dffa90b1e339b81883dc14037f7817f1cec15d

commit_message:
Don't ignore 'capabilities' flavor extra_spec

The ComputeCapabilitiesFilter would improperly ignore an extra spec of
'capabilities' since it matched the scope name.  When it's not scoped,
it should be treated as an unscoped extra_spec.

Fix bug 1198941.

Change-Id: I781754ae0cb9b2a9f7e7e973f4531f2a99a98d86

commit_message:
Nicira NVP plugin support for l3_ext_gw_mode extension

Bug 1121129

This patch adds support the 'configurable external gateway' extension
in the NVP plugin.

Change-Id: I531ebe0053b1b9e21d6f0685776acebe3173b170

'}, {'created': '2013-06-28 17:07:28.000000000', 'message': 'assignment backend

Splits the assignments functions off of the identity api
and manager, and moved them into their own backend.

To prevent breaking existing code, this adds assignment delegation
functions to Identity Manager.

There is a circular dependency between ID and assignments.

This code is mostly pure refactoring, with no changes to the
unit tests.  Existing behavior is maintained.

In the future, we will add unit tests for mixing an LDAP
identity provider with a SQL assignment backend.

blueprint split-identity

commit_message:
assignment backend

Splits the assignments functions off of the identity api
and manager, and moved them into their own backend.

To prevent breaking existing code, this adds assignment delegation
functions to Identity Manager.

There is a circular dependency between ID and assignments.

This code is mostly pure refactoring, with no changes to the
unit tests.  Existing behavior is maintained.

In the future, we will add unit tests for mixing an LDAP
identity provider with a SQL assignment backend.

blueprint split-identity

Change-Id: I6c180aa1ae626ace5b91e0bf1931bdaf2aa031d5

[{'created': '2013-06-27 15:25:22.000000000', 'message': 'Validate volume_size in block_device_mapping

The passed volume_size was not validated, causing
interesting backtraces elsewhere. Reject invalid
values upfront.

Create a common _validate_int_value() function for
validating that a parameter is an integer in a given
range. Use it also for min_count/max_count to share code.

Change-Id: I18ac285d5b3c8200d7706c7d577809b15d6ab9e8
'}, {'created': '2013-07-09 22:03:55.000000000', 'message': 'Validate volume_size in block_device_mapping

Reject invalid values for volume_size upfront.
For compatibility with old python-novaclient, an
empty volume_size is ignored.

Create a common _validate_int_value() function for
validating that a parameter is an integer in a given
range. Use it also for min_count/max_count to share code.

Fixes LP Bug#1199539

Change-Id: I18ac285d5b3c8200d7706c7d577809b15d6ab9e8
'}]
commit_message:
Validate volume_size in block_device_mapping

Reject invalid values for volume_size upfront.
For compatibility with old python-novaclient, an
empty volume_size is ignored.

Create a common _validate_int_value() function for
validating that a parameter is an integer in a given
range. Use it also for min_count/max_count to share code.

Fixes LP Bug#1199539

Change-Id: I18ac285d5b3c8200d7706c7d577809b15d6ab9e8

commit_message:
Refactor auditors to rely on expected gen names

Refactor the various auditors to rely on the audit_location_generator
yielding tuples containing paths with the expected suffix.

We also fix the exception handling for container_sync to not expect a
broker object (since the act of creating a broker object can raise an
exception).

For the object auditor we removed an unneeded check for disk_file
since get_data_file_size() will raise DiskFileNotExist under the same
condition (raises code coverage slightly).

Change-Id: I11d405e629063177ef21543b75e9076da1a03b61

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-01 07:41:54.000000000', 'message': "Reassign MAC address for vm  when resize_revert

In the case of a resize or migrate on the same host, we need to assign
a temp mac address to the source LPAR so we don't have a conflict when
another LPAR is booted with the same mac address as the original LPAR.
We need reassign the original mac address, replacing the temp mac on
the old instance during revert resize. The new instance has been
destroyed before this method, so remove the precondition to make sure
original mac address be set.

Fixes bug #1196404

Change-Id: I709292a7725f0a21f04f1c3c79f2fafc4437e402
"}]
commit_message:
Reassign MAC address for vm  when resize_revert

In the case of a resize or migrate on the same host, we need to assign
a temp mac address to the source LPAR so we don't have a conflict when
another LPAR is booted with the same mac address as the original LPAR.
We need reassign the original mac address, replacing the temp mac on
the old instance during revert resize. The new instance has been
destroyed before this method, so remove the precondition to make sure
original mac address be set.

Fixes bug #1196404

Change-Id: I709292a7725f0a21f04f1c3c79f2fafc4437e402

commit_message:
Add Fibre Channel image tranfer support.

This patch adds support to the base Fiber
Channel driver to do copy volume to image
and copy image to volume.

blueprint cinder-refactor-attach

Change-Id: I4155583bb7911587c5c7e1c4c0a8d522dcf032c1

commit_message:
Bug # 1200372 - Added hp3par_iscsi_ips to HP 3PAR configuration.

Added hp3par_iscsi_ips, replacing the generic (but singular)
iscsi_ip_address configuration key. Added paragraph explaining how iSCSI
address selection now works.

Fixes: bug 1200372

commit_message:
Removes duplicate registration of fping_path option

Duplicate registration of the same option can cause an error.
Since fping has moved to nova API v3, import the option from fping extention.

Change-Id: I8955cb358ca07c7f4bcd6e3e60066501ec0f6cb2
