revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-19 21:36:24.000000000', 'message': "Allow filters to onlyu run once per request if their data is static

Currently the filter_all() methond of each scheduler filter is run
once for each instance in a request, but for many filters the data
doesn't change during a request.

For example the data used by the AZ filter is pretty static, and not
filter any more hosts on sucessive runs.  However it is fairly
expensive to run on a large system.

Similarly the ServiceGroup information used by the compute filter
is cached as part of the host status, and doesn't need to be
evaluated more than once per request.

Only filters that are based on data that may change within a
request, for example resource consumption, need to be evaluated
for each instance.

This blueprint introduces a new attribute that allows filters to
declare that they only need to be run once per request. The default
behaviour is left as  a filter beinging evaluated for each
instance in a request.

The following existing filters are changed to only evaluate once
per request:

  AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter
  AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation
  AggregateTypeAffinityFilter
  AllHostsFilter
  AvailabilityZoneFilter
  ComputeCapabilitiesFilter
  ComputeFilter
  DifferentHostFilter
  GroupAntiAffinityFilter
  ImagePropertiesFilter
  IsolatedHostsFilter
  SameHostFilter
  SimpleCIDRAffinityFilter

In addition the function that does the check is defined in the
filter base class in a way that a filter that wants to run
(for example) once for every 10 instances in a request could
overload the function and implement its own behaviour.

Change-Id: Ia668f16414da86441323c58b1bbef5f88c81b90c

commit_message:
Allow filters to only run once per request if their data is static

Currently the filter_all() method of each scheduler filter is run
once for each instance in a request, but for many filters the data
doesn't change during a request.

For example the data used by the AZ filter is pretty static, and
doesn't filter any more hosts on successive runs.  However it is
fairly expensive to run on a large system.

Similarly the ServiceGroup information used by the compute filter
is cached as part of the host status, and doesn't need to be
evaluated more than once per request.

Only filters that are based on data that may change within a
request, for example resource consumption, need to be evaluated
for each instance.

This blueprint introduces a new attribute that allows filters to
declare that they only need to be run once per request. The default
behaviour is left so that a filter is evaluated once for each
instance in a request.

The following existing filters are changed to only evaluate once
per request:

  AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter
  AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation
  AggregateTypeAffinityFilter
  AllHostsFilter
  AvailabilityZoneFilter
  ComputeCapabilitiesFilter
  ComputeFilter
  DifferentHostFilter
  GroupAntiAffinityFilter
  ImagePropertiesFilter
  IsolatedHostsFilter
  SameHostFilter
  SimpleCIDRAffinityFilter

In addition the function that does the check is defined in the
filter base class in a way that a filter that wants to run
(for example) once for every 10 instances in a request could
overload the function and implement its own behaviour.

Implements: bp once-per-request-filters
Fixes: bug 1189557

Change-Id: Ia668f16414da86441323c58b1bbef5f88c81b90c

Why not a 409 error?

Also there seems to be some funny stuff going on in the code about which error to use for duplicates.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Joe,

400 is what is already defined in the existing code as the http return value for Invalid.   The change I'm making is just to bring the exceptions used by Quantum in line with that.  At the moment because they subclass NovaExecption there is no defined code, which results in a 500 error instead.

Sub-classing NetwordDuplicated of Duplicate would cause the same problem."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-10 16:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Exceptions raised by quantum validate_networks result in 500 error

The exceptions raised by validate_networks should be subclassed
from Invalid so they result in a 400 error

These exceptions are also used in allocate_for_instance

Fixes bug 1193421

Change-Id: If708e413d81a9d32bf81e7821d876736c4ac40ef

before so this patch adds some basic coverage.

Covers bug 1195549

Change-Id: I60b853eda48726b3bb752b7e3542b0fca74bc926
'}, {'created': '2013-06-30 01:56:17.000000000', 'message': "Check system_metadata type in _populate_instance_for_create

The _populate_instance_for_create method is passed a dictionary
of base instance values during create but it wasn't checking to
see if system_metadata was a dict or not which can lead to a

"}, {'created': '2013-07-01 13:54:23.000000000', 'message': "Check system_metadata type in _populate_instance_for_create

The _populate_instance_for_create method is passed a dictionary
of base instance values during create but it wasn't checking to
see if system_metadata was a dict or not which can lead to a
TypeError when booting an instance via the cells scheduler.

commit_message:
Check system_metadata type in _populate_instance_for_create

The _populate_instance_for_create method is passed a dictionary
of base instance values during create but it wasn't checking to
see if system_metadata was a dict or not which can lead to a
TypeError when booting an instance via the cells scheduler.

Fixes bug 1195549

Change-Id: I60b853eda48726b3bb752b7e3542b0fca74bc926

commit_message:
Ensure PortSecurityDBTestCase loads correct plugin

Bug 1201569

If a plugin is passed to the setUp method, that plugin
should be loaded instead od DB_PLUGIN_KLASS

Change-Id: I81df9f62e7399f5a76a07e504679ee8311e5855e

commit_message:
Add unittest for keystone.identity.backends.sql Models

This change introduces the unit testing of the SQL models against
their expected schema.

Fixes bug 1196855

Change-Id: I3939e474aa6e8e5549b1d89725e988dd056400d9

commit_message:
Re-assign quantum.api module as last operation

Bug 1199443

This avoids reset of locals in quantum/api/__init__.py,
resulting in sys being None when assigning quantum.api.extensions
to neutron.api.extensions

Change-Id: I2da8b336679b643c92824399a05ca1b9980d1598

commit_message:
xenapi: Only coalesce VHDs if needed

If the original parent is None, then we don't need to coalesce the VHD since
there won't be a grandparent for the child to coalesce into. Doing otherwise,
causes us to poll forever as we wait for the child's parent to become `None`.

Fixes bug 1200806

Change-Id: I0cbf0be86ff925b83c0b8fa90f88d4ca304fd2b9

Overall code LGTM. The only general question is how this change is related to bp v3-api-extension-versioning? Also could you please clarify the rationale behind the change? AFAIK v3 api targets to avoid duplicating other projects api (Cinder api in this case).

[adding Christopher Yeoh to the reviewers list]'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-07-09 23:48:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oleg, This is part of work of porting extension into v3, so this change related to bp v3-api-extension-versioning. You are right, we want to avoid duplicating other project. So just port the volume attachment part of exension 'os-volumes' into v3 that doesn't duplicate with cinder. Thanks, Alex"}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-07-09 23:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

commit_message:
Port attach and detach of volume-attachment into os-extended-volume v3

* Add attach and detach as server's action
* Change status code of attach to 202
* Catch exception explicitly
* Add more testcase

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I2e6324c3b7944afda7c32d438dc6e6d6f4f7502a

commit_message:
Change domain component value to org from com

Fixes Bug1200241

Changes variable value in keystone doc to proper a domain component and make it
consistent.

Change-Id: I0a9ac381d2da14c957df5aa50cb8f9dfadade1ac

commit_message:
Fix nic order not correct after reboot

Previously if an instance was rebooted or migrated the original nic order
would not be maintained. This patch retrieves the correct nic order from
info_cache so that the order is mantained.

Fixes bug 1187092

Change-Id: I3f5488cc14c692fde7d5bd3376389e2f2f5550ff

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-15 06:48:34.000000000', 'message': 'Work around a bug in haproxy reload on fedora 17

The current version of haproxy reload causes haproxy to be left in
a failed state.

Note: this should get fixed on newer versions of fedora when haproxy
gets a native systemd unit.

some references:
https://ask.openstack.org/question/2226/why-haproxy-fails-with-cfn-auto-scaling-template-heat-grizzly/
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=770305
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=561647

Change-Id: Idb42b3915cb86c613876b67abf1c6999972e19e2
'}, {'created': '2013-07-15 09:01:08.000000000', 'message': 'Don't reload haproxy and use ensureRunning=true

the ensureRunning option results in cfn-hup doing a restart and the
hook does a reload. these two options result in the failed state
of haproxy.

This patch rolls the two into "reload-or-restart", which is run from
cron.

https://ask.openstack.org/question/2226/why-haproxy-fails-with-cfn-auto-scaling-template-heat-grizzly/

Change-Id: Idb42b3915cb86c613876b67abf1c6999972e19e2
'}, {'created': '2013-07-15 23:08:41.000000000', 'message': 'Don't reload haproxy and use ensureRunning=true

the ensureRunning option results in cfn-hup doing a restart and the
hook does a reload. these two options result in the failed state
of haproxy.

This patch rolls the two into "reload-or-restart", which is run from
cron.

bug 1201621
Change-Id: Idb42b3915cb86c613876b67abf1c6999972e19e2
'}]
commit_message:
Don't reload haproxy and use ensureRunning=true

the ensureRunning option results in cfn-hup doing a restart and the
hook does a reload. these two options result in the failed state
of haproxy.

This patch rolls the two into "reload-or-restart", which is run from
cron.

bug 1201621
Change-Id: Idb42b3915cb86c613876b67abf1c6999972e19e2

:FORWARD ACCEPT [0:0]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [89366:510021281]

:quantum-openvswi-sg-fallback - [0:0]

May be I'm missing something, due to packet counting in the iptables.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': "Preserve packet:byte counts in iptables_manager.

Ported the nova iptables manager code to quantum, so that we
use iptables-save/restore with the -c flag to save/restore
the chains and rules with their packet:byte counts.  All other
changes were ported as well to keep the code as similar as
possible between the two, although they will be different as
I had to fix other bugs found during testing.

Updated tests accordingly to account for new calls and
input/output changes in formatting.

Changed iptables_firewall code to add iptables rules in the same
order that iptables-save will print them: source/dest, protocol,
sport, dport, target; else iptables_manager won't be able
to find them to preserve their [packet:byte] counts.
Tweaked other rules accordingly as necessary.

Fixed a bug introduced in an earlier version of this patch where
_modify_rules() sometimes wouldn't match an existing rule correctly
if not top=true.

Fixes bug 1125393

Change-Id: I858c552d8a7ae24f52f8e8daa05ac37026705773

commit_message:
Preserve packet:byte counts in iptables_manager.

Ported the nova iptables manager code to neutron, so that we
use iptables-save/restore with the -c flag to save/restore
the chains and rules with their packet:byte counts.  All other
changes were ported as well to keep the code as similar as
possible between the two, although they will be different as
I had to fix other bugs found during testing.

Updated tests accordingly to account for new calls and
input/output changes in formatting.

Changed iptables_firewall code to add iptables rules in the same
order that iptables-save will print them: source/dest, protocol,
sport, dport, target; else iptables_manager won't be able
to find them to preserve their [packet:byte] counts.
Tweaked other rules accordingly as necessary.

Fixed a bug introduced in an earlier version of this patch where
_modify_rules() sometimes wouldn't match an existing rule correctly
if not top=true.

Fixes bug 1125393

Change-Id: I858c552d8a7ae24f52f8e8daa05ac37026705773

commit_message:
Move special cells logic for start/stop

This moves towards better integration of cells logic by removing
the special start/stop code in cells_api.ComputeCellsAPI().  Instead,
the behavior difference for cells/non-cells for start/stop will only
be because of the different compute RPCAPI class.

Change-Id: Ie9bf694351d5f7f49c60b7d1ab5c4b2a679e3ab0

commit_message:
Bug # 1198743 - Updated revision history based on git commit log.

Updated revision history based on git commit log, editing summaries
where necessary to provide some level of consistency. Updates to tooling
(pom.xml) and updates where the summary was non-descriptive were
omitted (only a few of these were encountered).

This commit is up to date for all merges on the basic install guide as
at 1600 July 15 2013 US EST. Subsequent authors would need to ensure the
revision history is updated to include their changes.

Change-Id: Id9ef0daf4b7a67892380d3c122bbca59420bd2c9

[{'created': '2013-07-15 20:22:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to ignore backend HTTP error in BigSwitch plugin

This patch fixes the way the BigSwitch plugin ignores 404
errors from the backend controller by allowing HTTP codes
to be selectively ignored on REST calls. This prevents
unnecessary exception handling and failover logic in calls
where 404 codes are acceptable.

Fixes: bug #1200023

(cherry picked from commit 5b4ef2a513bc7c8d2a2eecb57f656bf42bb0dd52)
Change-Id: Ia1118c039af3b45d96fb3f8a5fb5d3febdf50f4f
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to ignore backend HTTP error in BigSwitch plugin

This patch fixes the way the BigSwitch plugin ignores 404
errors from the backend controller by allowing HTTP codes
to be selectively ignored on REST calls. This prevents
unnecessary exception handling and failover logic in calls
where 404 codes are acceptable.

Fixes: bug #1200023

(cherry picked from commit 5b4ef2a513bc7c8d2a2eecb57f656bf42bb0dd52)
Change-Id: Ia1118c039af3b45d96fb3f8a5fb5d3febdf50f4f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-15 20:29:28.000000000', 'message': "Clean list paging offset and limit values properly

The previous logic depended on the truth value of the arguments,
which resulted in calling int() on any object evaluating to True.
For instance, passing in a string that wasn't a number would result
in a ValueError.

Change-Id: I871a353b47a3c6c2dcd7d65ee365657435acf606
"}]
commit_message:
Clean list paging offset and limit values properly

The previous logic depended on the truth value of the arguments,
which resulted in calling int() on any object evaluating to True.
For instance, passing in a string that wasn't a number would result
in a ValueError.

Change-Id: I871a353b47a3c6c2dcd7d65ee365657435acf606

commit_message:
Implement port api action

Jobs have done in this patch
1. API to retrieve list of ports: Done
2. API to retrieve details of a single port: Done
3. API to create (insert) a new port: Done
4. API to update an existing port: Done
5. API and RPC to delete an existing port: Done
6. DB API of get_port_list and tests

Change-Id: Idd8c4ab9bc9e1eac2c0c93dfa699c81070f5fbe8

commit_message:
Change validate() to raise instead of returning T/F

Robert was right - it's better to allow driver.interface.validate to
raise an exception, and let that bubble up and be wrapped by the API, or
logged, than to wrap it at a low level and convert to True/False.

This patch changes the existing drivers' validate methods to remove
the exception wrapping, and updates some doc strings.

Change-Id: I02372db64ea0eb85a3c0a00de292c87d286808e1

commit_message:
Add helpers for single-node tasks.

Add two @properties to help facilitate use of single-node tasks,
and update docs accordingly.

While tasks should support multi-node operations, right now, most code
paths are fairly simple and only operating on a single node at a time.
The task.node and task.driver properties will make things DRYer.

Change-Id: Iff9202af623b1cdd25f6bc73bba679e47fa13a81

commit_message:
Migrating the create/resize code to use flavor obj

The flavor objects used to use memory_ram and flavor_id. The
change now passes around objects so any other flavor properties
can be used.

implements blueprint refactor-flavor-taskmanager

Change-Id: I2520e4e4eba430338445bff4d358eef9fb16f0d5

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-10 08:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is there any way to determine whether the parameters were specified in the environment or by the user? The ideal case would be to error on the latter but not the former.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-10 23:07:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Not at the moment, env and params get merged early in the API call, so that the RPC API didn't have to change."}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-07-11 04:00:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Zane's comment makes sense I think. But as Steve said it is impossible to determine whether the parameters were specified in the environment or by the user at the parameter validation stage.

However, what we can probably do is to let the parameter merge happen later at Stack creation time, more specifically, at the time env = environment.Environment(params) in service.EngineService.create_stack is executed. And with few modifications in environment.Environment, we can let environment.Environment strips off the extra environment variables that are not referenced by the template (one possible way of doing that is to provide another argument while constructing env - environment.Environment(params, tmpl) ). Or we can pass user_params and env_params separately while constructing Parameters.

If this idea makes sense, I can file a bug and follow up on it."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-12 00:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we should not commit this patch and in the heatclient check what keys are in env.parameters but not in template.parameters. You could then ask the user "do you want me to strip these out of the request Y/N". I think that would be the most user friendly, whilst been rigorous in the server.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-12 08:59:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The problem with asalkeld's idea is that it makes the (slow-moving) client need to be aware of the template format. I think that that part of HOT seems reasonably settled for now, so maybe we don't care, but this would limit our ability to evolve the HOT format."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-07-15 17:33:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Some level of template awareness in the client is inevitable, and can be done without slowing format evolution. The way to accomplish this is to make sure the server can do any client side bits that older clients aren't capable of."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-15 23:41:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

I'm happy to see what Liang comes up with here."}]

commit_message:
Revert "raise an UnknownUserParameter exception when receiving an unknown param"

This validation clashes with one of the objectives of environment
files, which was to allow the environment file to specify
defaults for common parameters, which may not all be represented
in the template.

Users may also have create scripts which would require reduced
customisation if common parameters could just be specified at all times.

This did provide validation which helps with a class of user error,
but in balance the tradeoff isn't worth it.

This reverts commit ea6e95189f623911ed63c613055ad5b2baa647f8.

Change-Id: I5155b9e60d76af70ba971b9208130884f2e30ee2

commit_message:
Improve presentation of stack parameter labels.

- Sets the parameter fields values to the defaults specified
  in the template validate response
- Orders the fields by required first
- By convention, parameters are specified in upper camel case.
  These are converted to be a more readable field label.

Change-Id: I8ad45f6e7dea47bc4c53ee4ec1c8a0593a27e374

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-15 18:14:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix random OverflowError exceptions in gate-neutron-python26 tests

These errors to be linked to the NEC plugin and http connections
not being stubbed out correctly. Latest failures seen occurred
during agent_scheduler tests. With this patch we ensure do_request
is stubbed out prior to the tests execution; this should be enough
to prevent these timeouts from occurring again. Stubbing out the
call has no effect on the coverage of the agent scheduler tests
for the NEC plugin.

Fixes bug #1201478

Change-Id: Iee3cb3cb3137cedcf97c707ea7fde9114b7264b6
'}, {'created': '2013-07-15 19:58:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix random OverflowError exceptions in gate-neutron-python26 tests

These errors seem to be linked to the NEC plugin and http connections
not being stubbed out correctly. This patch ensures do_request is
stubbed out prior to the tests execution; this should be enough
to prevent timeouts from occurring again. Stubbing out the call has
no effect on the coverage of the agent scheduler tests for the NEC
plugin.

Fixes bug #1201478

Change-Id: Iee3cb3cb3137cedcf97c707ea7fde9114b7264b6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix random OverflowError exceptions in gate-neutron-python26 tests

These errors seem to be linked to the NEC plugin and http connections
not being stubbed out correctly. This patch ensures do_request is
stubbed out prior to the tests execution; this should be enough
to prevent timeouts from occurring again. Stubbing out the call has
no effect on the coverage of the agent scheduler tests for the NEC
plugin.

Fixes bug #1201478

Change-Id: Iee3cb3cb3137cedcf97c707ea7fde9114b7264b6

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with older confirm_resize() calls

Commit ff4194bec79067bf77ab25caec1e40ad3709ea07 bumped the RPC
version and format for compute_confirm_resize() without providing
compatibility with older installations. This patch converts it
to a instance-dict style of primitive before sending it, if we're
pinned to an older version.

Change-Id: Ic631b70c005bfd0efe6965ad024890cc2caf947c

[{'created': '2013-06-27 16:05:50.000000000', 'message': 'Hypervisor uptime fails if service is disabled

Getting the uptime of a hypervisor fails because the db query
used to get the service filters out disabled hosts.

Instead we replace that query with one that always gets the
service if it exists, and a check that the sevice is up to
avoid an rpc call to a non running service.

Fixes bug 1195052

Change-Id: I97bc8a5002bd0f333207403d5b1878649612b762
'}]
commit_message:
Hypervisor uptime fails if service is disabled

Getting the uptime of a hypervisor fails because the db query
used to get the service filters out disabled hosts.

Instead we replace that query with one that always gets the
service if it exists, and a check that the sevice is up to
avoid an rpc call to a non running service.

Fixes bug 1195052

Change-Id: I97bc8a5002bd0f333207403d5b1878649612b762

[{'created': '2013-07-14 02:06:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix use of cinderclient NotFound exception

A while back (May 2013), python-cinderclient moved to using Oslo
exceptions for things. Apparently Nova's test_cinder never changed
the use of http_status instead of code for the HTTP error code.
I'm not sure why this wasn't failing before, but I'm betting it
has something to do with the fact that client version caps
were recently lifted.

Change-Id: I2ddfc56dfe6e9bdb01662b812465c40bffad2fdb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use of cinderclient NotFound exception

A while back (May 2013), python-cinderclient moved to using Oslo
exceptions for things. Apparently Nova's test_cinder never changed
the use of http_status instead of code for the HTTP error code.
I'm not sure why this wasn't failing before, but I'm betting it
has something to do with the fact that client version caps
were recently lifted.

Change-Id: I2ddfc56dfe6e9bdb01662b812465c40bffad2fdb

commit_message:
Use run-tests.sh for tox coverage tests

The coverage tests mustn't run in parallel and must have a working
mongod instance like other tests.

So just use the run-tests.sh with a special flags --coverage

Fix bug #1199411

Change-Id: Id750697a69213ee753280b7adc8f726dbdb1fca5

[{'created': '2013-07-11 11:17:28.000000000', 'message': 'Get correct hostname for nova to return instances running
on current machine.

socket.getfqdn() would return a fully qualified domain name
which is invalid for nova to get instances by hostname.

Fix bug: #1166717

Change-Id: Ic6cc8607bcdeee720c5d46d44fbaa589b4fb950e
'}, {'created': '2013-07-14 09:25:17.000000000', 'message': 'Use correct hostname to get instances.

socket.getfqdn() would return a fully qualified domain name
which maybe invalid for nova to get instances by hostname.
If the host that runs devstack is virtual(like running
devstack on AWS), socket.getfqdn() may return a domain name
which is not the host name and nova cannot use that to get
instances running on current host.

Fix bug: #1166717

Change-Id: Ic6cc8607bcdeee720c5d46d44fbaa589b4fb950e
'}]
commit_message:
Use correct hostname to get instances.

socket.getfqdn() would return a fully qualified domain name
which maybe invalid for nova to get instances by hostname.
If the host that runs devstack is virtual(like running
devstack on AWS), socket.getfqdn() may return a domain name
which is not the host name and nova cannot use that to get
instances running on current host.

Fix bug: #1166717

Change-Id: Ic6cc8607bcdeee720c5d46d44fbaa589b4fb950e

commit_message:
Allow to specify the endpoint type to use

Not everybody will want to use publicURL, so let's make this configurable.

Change-Id: Ice85a8ef1083580d89285e83239de872939665af
Fixes: bug#1188469

commit_message:
Request for a pty in the ssh sessions

The sudo on many systems checks for secure tty/pty before any other
security checks.

Having the ssh to use a tty even for remote command execution, can
solve this issue.

Change-Id: Ie19a45b245e274f9e3f502c65418d305e1babbbe

commit_message:
Fix SSH host to floating IP from fixed IP

SSH cannot reach to the server, if Tempest node is different from
OpenStack node.
This test case should set floating IP to the server.
This Patche sets floating IP to the server.

Change-Id: Ib38bad9145f51b805142ee26bd02f4f0d5eee2ee
Fixes: bug #1199202

typically before we change a test to handle a core service change, we want to see at least one +2 on that core service change to ensure that's what's wanted. So please solicit that for the nova change, and we'll look at this."}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-07-08 19:51:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi,

The changes in the test were made to fix the build after changes were made to the instance rebuild flow, refer https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35278/

I don't think the changes would be reviewed until the build passes, so this fix to the tempest test would be required for the build to pass."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-10 06:22:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The original test cases refereed to to a not existing path.
FIXME: The file injection never created directories for the injection.

So the test case is not compatible with the cirros image where the main disk's filesystem (not the initrd or initramfs) does not contains an /etc folder."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-07-10 06:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-15 11:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

maybe this is an issue of the commit message just not being good enough to make it clear where the issue is.

Before this change, this test runs fine in the gate (running on cirros 0.3.1 image. So can you explain in more detail why this change is needed? Or is there an assert we aren't doing correctly that would show this isn't actually working?"}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-07-15 11:50:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Sean,

Before the fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35278/ , we couldn't rebuild a server with the personality files, because even if the personality files were passed as part of the rebuild request it was ignored.

I have made changes to fix this issue. In tempest, the cirros image used for tests has an empty root file system. So when we try to create a file under the /etc/  folder it fails due to the absence of the folder and the instance goes to error state and this fails the test. The instance create test also passes personality files with relative path, I have done changes similar to the same."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-15 20:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-15 20:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Using relative path for personality file in rebuild server test.

Personality files with absolute paths e.g /etc/rebuild.txt breaks on the test
cirros image. This is because cirros has an empty root filesystem.

fixes lp 1187629

Change-Id: I5b2b37224b722686c3163214fbd53227ac9ce49f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-12 13:24:35.000000000', 'message': "Call virt.driver.destroy before deallocating network.

Call virt driver destroy before releasing the instance's
ip address, so that certain failures can be handled.
For instance, if destroy raises InstancePowerOffFailure,
do not deallocate network resources.

Fixes bug 1180178

Change-Id: I9bde984d2393bd73a73eae6065defb2ed7c01492
(cherry picked from commit dacb187fcd685c15fd084fdfce8c5e165130ff54)
"}]
commit_message:
Call virt.driver.destroy before deallocating network.

Call virt driver destroy before releasing the instance's
ip address, so that certain failures can be handled.
For instance, if destroy raises InstancePowerOffFailure,
do not deallocate network resources.

Fixes bug 1180178

Change-Id: I9bde984d2393bd73a73eae6065defb2ed7c01492
(cherry picked from commit dacb187fcd685c15fd084fdfce8c5e165130ff54)

commit_message:
Add large_ops scenario test

Try spinning up a specific number of instances (set via config) by using
the min_instances option. And make sure all instances go to active
state. Note since the number of instances a cloud can handle is cloud
specific this test is disabled by default.

This can be used in Devstack by using the 'VIRT_DRIVER=fake' option in
devstack.

Change-Id: I30c7d7d113053b47d6dffa6295ad6068810cad32

commit_message:
Test Tokens - V3

Adds test script "test_tokens.py" so as to validate v3 password
authentication for a given user. Support functions are added in
client files in both the interfaces.

Implements: blueprint keystone-tokens-test
Change-Id: I9a810844b1d991f829f411db308e37a02bd6c09e

commit_message:
Remove references to deprecated DnsMasqFilter

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/16803/ compatibility
for FLAGFILE has been added. It is time to remove this
again for Havana.

Change-Id: I1304132320f7d7d381b9e6548337afed52f1e96a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 08:20:03.000000000', 'message': "Sync harmless changes from oslo-incubator

Includes these commits:

  3948aee Highlighting the deprecated nature of 'log-format'.
  b21fc56 Fix bad default for show_deleted
  d28fa69 python3: Add python3 compatibility.
  0bf03b7 Add network_utils.urlsplit
  e456727 Remove useless logging in networks_utils
  7119e29 Enable hacking H404 test.
  b41862d Use param keyword for docstrings
  2f01388 Use Python 3.x compatible except construct
  e3545f8 Enable hacking H402 test
  484a1df Enable hacking H403 test
  35660da Enable hacking H401 test
  874249e Add support for requirements.txt.
  b135234 Remove the notifier and its dependencies from log.py
  926b3e9 Fixes import order nits

Changes which may look not look so harmless:

 - the common get_admin_context() method is not used by Nova
 - network_utils.urlsplit() is added but not used yet
 - suppport for requirements.txt is added to patch_tox_venv but
   actually it doesn't use those files

Change-Id: I03e67f4648dcaf57620f11e63cfd8e7dbe3665cb
"}]
commit_message:
Sync harmless changes from oslo-incubator

Includes these commits:

  3948aee Highlighting the deprecated nature of 'log-format'.
  b21fc56 Fix bad default for show_deleted
  d28fa69 python3: Add python3 compatibility.
  0bf03b7 Add network_utils.urlsplit
  e456727 Remove useless logging in networks_utils
  7119e29 Enable hacking H404 test.
  b41862d Use param keyword for docstrings
  2f01388 Use Python 3.x compatible except construct
  e3545f8 Enable hacking H402 test
  484a1df Enable hacking H403 test
  35660da Enable hacking H401 test
  874249e Add support for requirements.txt.
  b135234 Remove the notifier and its dependencies from log.py
  926b3e9 Fixes import order nits

Changes which may look not look so harmless:

 - the common get_admin_context() method is not used by Nova
 - network_utils.urlsplit() is added but not used yet
 - suppport for requirements.txt is added to patch_tox_venv but
   actually it doesn't use those files

Change-Id: I03e67f4648dcaf57620f11e63cfd8e7dbe3665cb

commit_message:
Implement extend volume functionality in SolidFire

This implements the extend volume functionality for SolidFire driver.

Implements: blueprint solidfire-extend-size-support

Change-Id: I00dc15f722c70b8835ae5a060ca8f0c4a80a1acb

[{'created': '2013-07-12 12:03:59.000000000', 'message': 'Neutron Security Group native support

blueprint quantum-security-group

Rule table view
* Add direction and ethertype columns (which are specific to Neutron)
  It may be better to hide "Direction" and "Ether Type" columns
  unless Quantum security group is enabled.
* Merge ip_protocol/from_port/to_port into one column for better view
* Use "::/0" for IPv6 ANY instead of "0.0.0.0/0"
* Rename "Source" column to "Remote".
  (The naming "source" does not fit egress rules)
* Display security group name in the title of rule detail view

Rule creation form
* New arguments 'direction' and 'ethertype' in security_group_rule_create()
* Set the default value of 'direction' to 'ingress' in forms.handle()
* Rename 'ip_protocol' to 'rule_menu' and 'source' to 'remote'
  Note that rule_menu is retrieved from rule.ip_protocol in the unit tests
  since they are tests for custom TCP/UDP/ICMP rules.

Network abstraction layer for security group management
* Move security group methods to api.network
* Add Neutron security group API implementation
* Move base classes for network abstraction to a separate module
  (api/network_base.py) to avoid circulated import between
  api.network and api.nova/api.neutron

Add a configuration parameter to control Neutron security group support
* Neutron security group support is enabled when Neutron is enabled and
  enable_security_group in OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK in settings is True.
* Not all neutron plugins support security group, so we need a way
  to control neutron security group is enabled or not.
* It can be determined by supported extension list from Neutron
  and it is a possible future work.

Move get_int_or_uuid to openstack_dashboard/utils/filters.
* get_int_or_uuid is now used in security_group implementation as
  well as floating IP logics.
* In addition the depth of the directory tree becomes longer and
  it is hard to fit the import line in 80 chars.
  It is a good chance to move it to a common directory.

Add __repr__ to API**Wrapper to make it easier to debug.

Limitations:
Neutron supports per-port security group. security groups can be
associated with a port instead of an instace and each port can have
a different set of security groups. It is not a scope of this BP
and is a future work.

Change-Id: I5410e88043a364596037b9ebcc566cd50b317614
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron Security Group native support

blueprint quantum-security-group

Rule table view
* Add direction and ethertype columns (which are specific to Neutron)
  It may be better to hide "Direction" and "Ether Type" columns
  unless Quantum security group is enabled.
* Merge ip_protocol/from_port/to_port into one column for better view
* Use "::/0" for IPv6 ANY instead of "0.0.0.0/0"
* Rename "Source" column to "Remote".
  (The naming "source" does not fit egress rules)
* Display security group name in the title of rule detail view

Rule creation form
* New arguments 'direction' and 'ethertype' in security_group_rule_create()
* Set the default value of 'direction' to 'ingress' in forms.handle()
* Rename 'ip_protocol' to 'rule_menu' and 'source' to 'remote'
  Note that rule_menu is retrieved from rule.ip_protocol in the unit tests
  since they are tests for custom TCP/UDP/ICMP rules.

Network abstraction layer for security group management
* Move security group methods to api.network
* Add Neutron security group API implementation
* Move base classes for network abstraction to a separate module
  (api/network_base.py) to avoid circulated import between
  api.network and api.nova/api.neutron

Add a configuration parameter to control Neutron security group support
* Neutron security group support is enabled when Neutron is enabled and
  enable_security_group in OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK in settings is True.
* Not all neutron plugins support security group, so we need a way
  to control neutron security group is enabled or not.
* It can be determined by supported extension list from Neutron
  and it is a possible future work.

Move get_int_or_uuid to openstack_dashboard/utils/filters.
* get_int_or_uuid is now used in security_group implementation as
  well as floating IP logics.
* In addition the depth of the directory tree becomes longer and
  it is hard to fit the import line in 80 chars.
  It is a good chance to move it to a common directory.

Add __repr__ to API**Wrapper to make it easier to debug.

Limitations:
Neutron supports per-port security group. security groups can be
associated with a port instead of an instace and each port can have
a different set of security groups. It is not a scope of this BP
and is a future work.

Change-Id: I5410e88043a364596037b9ebcc566cd50b317614

commit_message:
Remove notify_on_any_change option

This option isn't really needed, since the case it defends is already
covered by notify_on_state_change. Let's simplify the configuration a
bit by removing it.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I35071abdea2d2380d79c07e9134e095bda65a13d
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Prompt for password on stack create.

Providing a password is now mandatory during stack create.

commit_message:
Sync pytz from requirements.txt

pip 1.4 is imminent, and doesn't install pre-release versions if you
don't ask for them - this includes the date-based version of pytz.

Change-Id: I52fa89005dfedf94a469b3601b3c3d6356eb0174

'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-07-15 17:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hrm... I run functional tests on a SAIO VM with a ~ 1G file mounted loopback, in 4 chunks, and they pass.

I think the existing work-around allowing functional tests to successfully complete on VMs with small disk(s) is to set this in your /etc/swift/*-server.conf files:

  [DEFAULT]
  ...
  disable_fallocate = true

Have you tried that?'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-15 21:42:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes indeed saio tell people to disable_fallocate when we should do it in devstack to get this working. I'll submit a patch there then thanks."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-15 21:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

as per he discussion this is a configuration problem.'}]

commit_message:
Allow skipping large uploads in functional tests

- On a VM with usually small disks this tests would fails.
- Fixes bug 1201077

Change-Id: I6b0f550681c4ab853061834bb22a3bb3e29e2375

commit_message:
Revert "Merge "HP3PAR extra-specs key fix"

This should not have been merged back to stable/grizzly as the bug
fix was only checked into the trunk(havana) branch.

This reverts commit 872beece8fe8a3d7eb9ed67fcc207a90dad28028, reversing
changes made to 789b789b443505edf8b9fe9096ba22609a7f2250.

Change-Id: I5594b9b109c604d9a7d85ad5cb9aa2708699de4c

commit_message:
Fix a few visual issues on the network topology diagram.

This commit separates CIDR labels with a comma and adjusts the vertical
positioning of port labels for improved readability.

Change-Id: I57510033fcc309b5d570d7ee6a9369a97775719b
Fixes: bug #1199086

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-12 15:23:38.000000000', 'message': 'DB Driver for the Registry Service

This patch adds a database driver that talks to a remote registry
service, which talks directly to a database back-end. The registry
service implements all the database API public functions that are
actually used from outside the API.

In order to test this patch correctly, it was necessary to add an
auth_token to each context used in the base tests and update that token
were needed.

NOTE: This patch adds tests for the above said driver but, it doesn't
add Visibility tests. The reason is that those tests are meant for
actual database back-ends. Given the "proxy" nature of this driver and
the fact that it doesn't do anything on the data returned by the remote
registry service, it isn't worth adding those tests. However, this
review does have support for DriverTests and implements each one of
them.

Implements blueprint registry-db-driver

Change-Id: I60f8e25c406c8e62b343267ba00f23299b19d4e5

commit_message:
DB Driver for the Registry Service

This patch adds a database driver that talks to a remote registry
service, which talks directly to a database back-end. The registry
service implements all the database API public functions that are
actually used from outside the API.

In order to test this patch correctly, it was necessary to add an
auth_token to each context used in the base tests and update that token
were needed.

NOTE: This patch adds tests for the above said driver but, it doesn't
add Visibility tests. The reason is that those tests are meant for
actual database back-ends. Given the "proxy" nature of this driver and
the fact that it doesn't do anything on the data returned by the remote
registry service, it isn't worth adding those tests. However, this
review does have support for DriverTests and implements each one of
them.

Implements blueprint registry-db-driver

Change-Id: I60f8e25c406c8e62b343267ba00f23299b19d4e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 23:22:14.000000000', 'message': 'Adding the ability to set/use domain context

Setting the domain context allows admins to view the identity
resources (projects, users, groups) for a particular domain.
The context can be set or cleared.  The default is no domain
context set.  If no context set, the current behavior of listing
all resources across domains is maintained.

Additionally, the identity panels have been grouped in a new
PanelGroup called Identity Panel to logically separate this
functionality from other service related panels.

Implements: blueprint domain-context

Change-Id: I5dd6279129824971968c20fd30919b109bf6b00a

commit_message:
Adding the ability to set/use domain context

Setting the domain context allows admins to view the identity
resources (projects, users, groups) for a particular domain.
The context can be set or cleared.  The default is no domain
context set.  If no context set, the current behavior of listing
all resources across domains is maintained.

Additionally, the identity panels have been grouped in a new
PanelGroup called Identity Panel to logically separate this
functionality from other service related panels.

Implements: blueprint domain-context

Change-Id: I5dd6279129824971968c20fd30919b109bf6b00a

[{'created': '2013-07-06 22:34:58.000000000', 'message': "Add ini_setting based custom types for configs

Previous configuration file management method used templates.
This method had limited flexibility and was cumbersome
to use and maintain.

This change introduces new custom types based on ini_setting:
  * swift_account_config: /etc/swift/account-server.conf
  * swift_bench_config: /etc/swift/swift-bench.conf
  * swift_config: /etc/swift/swift.conf
  * swift_container_config: /etc/swift/container-server.conf
  * swift_dispersion_config: /etc/swift/dispersion.conf
  * swift_object_config: /etc/swift/object-server.conf
  * swift_proxy_config: /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf

The use of ini_setting offers multiple advantages:
  * Ability to individually manage configuration settings without
    the need to modify templates. This allows the user to manage or
    override settings that aren't handled by the module.
  * Use upstream default values if none is provided.
  * Remove the need to maintain and synchronize templates
    to match upstream versions. Such maintenance could become
    problematic and complicated if multiple upstream versions
    are supported but have different base configuration files.

Change-Id: I17d8e58cedc9c23b60e1a76c69d05cb36386227e

commit_message:
Add ini_setting based custom types for configs

Previous configuration file management method used templates.
This method had limited flexibility and was cumbersome
to use and maintain between upstream versions.

This change introduces new custom types based on ini_setting:
  * swift_account_config: /etc/swift/account-server.conf
  * swift_bench_config: /etc/swift/swift-bench.conf
  * swift_config: /etc/swift/swift.conf
  * swift_container_config: /etc/swift/container-server.conf
  * swift_dispersion_config: /etc/swift/dispersion.conf
  * swift_object_config: /etc/swift/object-server.conf
  * swift_proxy_config: /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf

The use of ini_setting offers multiple advantages:
  * Ability to individually manage configuration settings without
    the need to modify templates. This allows the user to manage or
    override settings that aren't handled by the module.
  * Use upstream default values if none is provided.
  * Remove the need to maintain and synchronize templates
    to match upstream versions. Such maintenance could become
    problematic and complicated if multiple upstream versions
    are supported but have different base configuration files.

Implements: blueprint puppet-swift-ini-settings
Change-Id: I17d8e58cedc9c23b60e1a76c69d05cb36386227e

commit_message:
Use base ISCSI driver to fulfill some driver requirements

Cinder has a list of minimum features that must be implemented by each
driver. This uses the copy_volume_to_image and copy_image_to_volume
implementation from the base ISCSI class. Also use the base for raising
NotImplementedError. This touches the Nexenta and Zadara driver.

Change-Id: I44a347e126a783e38d3a68cba23306a571aec43b

[{'created': '2013-07-15 13:15:23.000000000', 'message': 'HP3PAR Block Storage extra-specs key fix

This fix will cover the documentation impact related to the scoping
of custom extra-specs changes fixed in bug: 1194289

https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1194289

commit_message:
HP3PAR Block Storage extra-specs key fix

This fix will cover the documentation impact related to the scoping
of custom extra-specs changes fixed in bug: 1194289

https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1194289

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/34465

Change-Id: I2984278655afa7ded2fd4100b374f8406f4e3054

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-31 05:21:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

One concern I have with this patch is that the exception classes are walking a different path with openstack/common/exception.py.

I don't mind apiclient having its own exception module but how about putting common exception class patterns in openstack/common/exception.py and inheriting from there?

For example openstack.common.exception.ApiError seems to have somethings in common with HttpError"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-31 06:54:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

openstack.common.exceptions is something we want to get rid of

As APIs move out into separate library packages, they need to include their own exception classes

We'll never have e.g. an oslo.exceptions library"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-31 08:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Mark, I see. Then the projects using OpenstackException should roll back to its own BaseException class?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-31 09:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Yes, we should work on eliminating openstack.common.exceptions'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-05-31 17:38:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

LGTM, can you confirm it's broken down into 4 patches and should go in this order? 

1) exceptions - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29706/
2) utils - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29705/
3) main apiclient - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30065/
4) keyring - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29803/"}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-05-31 19:40:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Yes, it is broken into several patches. Exceptions are the main commit (the parent of others), but the rest are relatively independent and can go in any order.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-10 16:48:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add exceptions for OpenStack clients

These exceptions can be used in novaclient, keystoneclient,
glanceclient, and other client projects.

Concept of this file comes from cloudservers/exceptions.py
and novaclient/exceptions.py. HTTP exceptions were rewritten.

Partially implements: blueprint common-client-library

Change-Id: I9e17d855f7c26284ce66b13515aa4a0b8855347a

commit_message:
Complete deletion when compute manager start-up.

Sometimes instances stay in DELETED state (vm_state) but are not
marked as deleted in the DB.
The combination of vm_state=DELETED and deleted=0 is a valid
combination but if we found it during the compute manager start-up that is
an indication that something went wrong while we were deleting an instance.
The aim of this change is just to complete the deletion during the compute
mangager start-up for instances found in that state.

bug 1187422
Change-Id: I52efa07b4d98106214fc54aee3af9de6eacb58d9

commit_message:
Porting limits core api to API v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ifb20626d796b762b0f7420e773cdb5038bcb1589

commit_message:
Fix 'glance-cache-manage -h' default interpolation

Some options were showing up as %(default)s when running
"glance-cache-manage -h".

Fixes bug 1197472

Change-Id: I1c7586cbc52445e3bdca28a71378f40ecb5b07a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-01 10:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute

The Exception class has a 'message' attribute:

  >>> Exception('foo').message
  'foo'

however, we follow a pattern that results in the attribute being
shadowed by a class attribute:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     message = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.message % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo %s'

whereas, we obviously want behaviour like this:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     msg_fmt = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.msg_fmt % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo bar'

Avoid this shadowing by using 'msg_fmt' as the name of the class
attribute. Add a test which fails without this fix.

Change-Id: I304f31edec20b1293cf6c8de931415590fde6752

commit_message:
Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute

The Exception class has a 'message' attribute:

  >>> Exception('foo').message
  'foo'

however, we follow a pattern that results in the attribute being
shadowed by a class attribute:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     message = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.message % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo %s'

whereas, we obviously want behaviour like this:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     msg_fmt = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.msg_fmt % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo bar'

Avoid this shadowing by using 'msg_fmt' as the name of the class
attribute. Add a test which fails without this fix.

Change-Id: I304f31edec20b1293cf6c8de931415590fde6752
